text: I went here for dinner and hands down best meal I had in Vegas. Our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu and gave us great suggestions. We ended up ordering  the burrata agnolotti ... It was amazing! We also had the caprese salad which was delicious as well. So glad we happened upon this restaurant. This is a great place for a romantic dinner or just an elegant dinner with friends.

This is, hands down, the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, by far. Every dish is carefully crafted to amuse all 5 senses. There's nothing on the the menu is would be considered a bad dish. My mother doesn't eat seafood at all, she had the branzino here because it was delicious. The room as absolutely beautiful. It's the perfect place for a date night or even a proposal. The service is perfection. They have the best wine selection in town. This is the best kept secret in Vegas. A must try.

Honestly the best overall dining experience I have had in Las Vegas and I've had some great ones.  
Chris Zadie, Portofino's GM, is fantastic.  He went out of his way explaining the restaurant, the menu, and the ingredients.  His passion for the restaurant and the food was obvious and contagious with the rest of the staff.  The service is truly a cut above.
Diners are encouraged to sample multiple items on the menu as most dishes can be ordered as full or half orders.  The pasta is made fresh and cooked to order....haven't had pasta this good outside of Italy.
Truly an excellent experience.  Kudos to Chris and the staff.

Find a different restaurant...cold food, not culinary quality, expensive. Inept staff.

We had a table for 10 for a company dinner.  Waiter suggested a larger group appetizer which sounded like it was something special for larger groups.  It turned out to basically be individual appetizers put on large plates.  10 meatballs cost $75 which I didn't know until the final bill came.  Shame on me.  All together about $160 plus for 10 meatballs, 2 crab cakes, and some calamari.

Three people ordered the chicken rollatini parmesan.  All came out basically luke warm to almost cold.  The roll is served cut into 3 pieces over a bed of tomato sauce.  2 orders were sent back.  I had taken a couple of bites out of one of mine.  Mine came back with only 2 pieces and was told they did that to tell the 2 orders apart when reserving.   Additionally, one side of my plate was "almost warmed up" and sufficient, but still lacking,  The other piece and side of the place was still luke warm to cold.

Waiter finally offered me a glass of wine or dessert.  What I wanted was a great dinner for a $36 plate and paying a bill for 10 people.  Other dishes were inspiring.

Two people we know went there the night before and we were warned, but they explained it up to a bad night.  For supposedly fresh made pasta, their pasta was mushy, etc.

Again, find a different restaurant.

Great service at the bar. Enjoyed the meatballs but the crab cakes were not to my liking. They have risotto with some crab which then appeared to be deep fried. Be warned it is very different than a traditional breaded crab cake.

What a wonderful surprise!  

I was a bit reticent about dining here as the bar entrance is narrow, too bright and uninviting.   However, the interior beyond is warm, calming, visually beautiful and welcoming. 

Most importantly, the food was truly amazing. Fresh, homemade pasta, reasonable portions, flavor galore. 

Service was excellent and for our visit the chef came out and grated truffles on our dishes. 

One of the best kept secrets on the strip. Definitely will return.

I am so surprised that I am the first one to review Onda!  We went to Onda for a family dinner before seeing Love (the new Cirque du Soleil show, also at The Mirage).  Onda was...decadent.  The restaurant is divded into two sections - a wine and cheese bar, and then the standard restaurant.  I have only dined in the standard restaurant, but the wine room looked pretty incredible!  

You can see photos and the menu on The Mirage's website: http://www.mirage.com/dining/fine_dining_onda.aspx.

Service was excellent. Atmosphere is nice without being stuffy. Food, however was ok. The lobster bisque and endive salad appetizers were very good. We had the sea bass, lasagna and rigatoni bolognese. The lasagna was the best, but still could have made a better lasagna. The ratio of ingredients was off- it made it primarily a meat lasagna with little cheese or sauce. For this price tag, don't think it's worth it.

My husband and I recently had the opportunity to dine here and this restaurant was absolutely amazing.

We started with the Roasted Bone Marrow, which was a new experience for both of us and while it sounds distasteful to some, the presentation was beautiful; still in the bone and paired with sardines, which complimented each other perfectly. It was also accompanied by a visit from the manager who spoke with us a while and gave a proper background on how it was prepped and more information on the idea of marrow itself.

We then ordered Burrata Agnolotti and Chicken Rollatini Parmasean for our main entrees and then a beautiful creme brule for dessert.

The staff was attentive and courteous and the manager visited a few times and made us feel extremely welcome. Their seating/couches are lovely. I would definitely recommend Portofino to anyone who is looking for a romantic dinner out. .

Fantastic bar!  The service at the bar sets the standard for me on what I hope for in a bartender.  Friendly, funny, gregarious, a generous pouring hand. Love this place and been coming for many years. Always several LOL moments if you're willing to be a friendly guest !

Such an incredible dining experience! The food was authentic and delectable!! The menu was varied--suited for every palate. Impeccable service--special kudos to Lito for his warmth, kindness and attentiveness. Highly recommend for those desiring a satisfying Italian meal. GRAZIE!!

Made a last minute stop here for dinner before a show. Didn't have a reservation, but the hostess was friendly and able to seat the two of us quickly.  Nice atmosphere and an attractive space. Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive. We started with the pasta fagioli soup which was good but a bit bland for my taste.  The complementary focaccia bread they bring to the table was excellent.   My wife ordered the chicken rollatini Parmesan and I got the lasagna. Both were excellent.  Overall the experience was very enjoyable with great food, great service and a beautiful atmosphere.  The only reason I removed one star was because during our meal a photographer who worked for the resort was going around taking pictures of people in the restaurant and trying to sell the photos. I found it a bit tacky.

What an amazing hidden gem in the Mirage. Food is delicious! The ambiance is okay, nothing trendy or hip it's more old school restaurant look but missing a few key pieces to making it charming. If you go for the food, which is for sure worth it, you won't be disappointed. Top on our list is the veal osso bucco and any pasta that has their fresh sweet corn sauce!

When arriving after our typical 360 mile, six hour drive to Vegas, Mirage was told by us (at check in around 12:30 a.m.) that you always promise us something for hotel reservations, and when we get here, it is as if we are second class.  Ok..ok... so I had my Bob's Big Boy infamous T on...Then those nice people, after straightening our room out the next day, left us with a nice bottle champagne and two glasses on ice for our trouble.  

"I need cheese with this, damn it!" was my cutie's comment, so we decided (after losing at the slots) we would cool off and find a place we could down the bubbly with some bread and cheese and talk about what a bunch of idiots we were for playing the slots. 

So my honey wanted to go to "FIN"...Ok, no biggie.

Oh what a thing...When FIN (the place next door to Onda) told my wife that they would have to charge us $25.00 corkage fee...well, she was pissed and I about frazzled.

Luckily for us the manager at Onda was standing outside and heard us.  He told us, "Bring the bottle and I will charge you nothing to uncork it and drink it in my bar area."

Damnit Vegas!  That's what I call Customer Service!  That is exactly how you gain my allegiance!  By hunting me down and making me feel like I am someone special.  (Especially in front of my sweetheart.) Yes, like a guy that's got it going on...not the average snobby Vegas, stick it in your ass if you don't like it, approach.  God, I am so sick-and-ass-tired of that B.S.!

Well, we jammed upstairs and flew back down before "Hold Me Tight."  (look that up you Beatles fans) was done playing.  Then he offered us the going rate for Happy Hour of mussels at 7:01 p.m. in a light-spicy-marinara sauce.  And all you can eat!

Before you could say "Hob nail boots" and "Everybody had a wet dream",  we were sitting down and my honey was close.  

Man did I get my $20.00 worth of mussels!  And then the mushrooms...and then...some cab...Man it was good!  Well, do I really have to paint you a picture?

$95.00 later out of my wallet (and I did not mind one little bit!) I got the bill.  Too bad the idiot at FIN was so short sighted (and $95.00 poorer, the dumb ass) by being the typical greedy-ass-Vegas-restaurateur by  lying to my wife and saying that a corkage fee was law in Vegas. IT"S NOT for wine and /or champagne! So there, you prick!

God, those mussels were out-frickin-rageous!  The bubbly good with the bread...Well so good it helped get the honey upstairs and in my arms.  Woof! Woof!  I was once again someone important in her eyes!

You want me back, Mirage?  Ya want me back, Vegas?  The manager at Onda knows how to play the best game in town.  By kissing my ass and making me feel like a someone.  Thank you, sir!  You have my undying gratitude by performing customer service the best way.  You get it by using common-damn-sense!  I will be back!,

FIN???  Up yours, you greedy jerks!

Ate here alone, at the bar, and had a great meal.  As is usual with Las Vegas, drinks and dinner are expensive.  They had a nice daily wine, a Chianti, for $12 and it was delicious with a generous pour.  The bartender was excellent - good service and friendly.  I ordered the Branzino fish - it was like a sea bass, served with the skin on, no head.  Creamy, juicy.  The sides were good (grilled asparagus, but only got 2 teensy tiny fingerling potatoes).  I was not hungry and the size was perfect - not too much.  They also served an outstanding basket of bread that had been soaked on olive oil.  It was fantastic.  I had originally gone to Stacks to eat - but after sitting for 5 minutes at the bar with no service I decided to leave.  Very glad that I did as I was not disappointed with Portofino.  I would return here.
Best restaurant hands down in LV.  Unbelievable service and great new menu.  Chris the manager is one of the best in the business.  A must stop if your are visiting the Mirage.
Superior food!! Fantastic service. Our server Sheri was very friendly, helped us pick the best dish. We will definitely be returning.

Great Restaurant ! Homemade Pasta made to order and cooked to YOUR order.
Great service and a water was always on hand to serve your needs. The mai·tre d' was awesome and gave great wine recommendations. The only negative was that I would like to see more wines by the glass and perhaps a few more wines under $10.00 per glass.  Otherwise, Perfecto !

Upscale Italian ... I don't think so. First off the waiters and kitchen were not very receptive to food allergies.  The flavors were muddled, not too vibrant, and masked with salt and garlic.  The best part of the meal was the fresh mozzarella in the caprese salad, albeit the tomatoes were over ripe.  Because of an allergy I could only eat one entree on the menu, the ripatelli.  For being toted as the best homemade parpadelle pasta, I have to disagree as it was mush, swimming in a pool of evoo, accompanied by average sausage and chopped rabe.  As for the others in my party, they each had the lasagne. Again a good sales pitch. The only reason we didn't send it back for something different was the 60 minute wait and we had a show to see ... yes, 60 minutes from the time of the order until the entree was delivered. Oh, yes the ripatelli was talking back all night long.    Diner beware. This is not worth it!
Great meal, great setting and service. Skipped the pasta meals and had filet and veal osso bucco. Both tasty and well presented. The risotto was super tasty and a nice accompaniment to the veal

The food was great - I think that there are probably better options at that price point in Vegas, but I had no complaints.  I had a filet and South African lobster - both were cooked perfectly and were awesome.  We also got the soufflé for dessert, which you usually need to order 20 minutes or so in advance, but this took forever!!
The filet was one if the best pieces of meat in my life.  Amazing!!!!  I highly recommend.  Service was stellar.

Tomatoes on caprese salad were past their prime ... wrinkly skin and mealy.  The flavors and texture of my husband's chicken parmesan reminded him of the veal parmesan he had at "hojos" (howard johnsons's) when he was a child -- not a good thing.  And, my veal pacino - milanese style - lacked seasoning and had greasy breading (tasted like the frying oil was past it's prime by a couple of weeks - the oil was the primary flavor) ... the veal was quite fatty in places ... and the salad greens (even before application of dressing) were wilted.

Ambiance needs refreshing.

Disappointing.

Food: The food was a pleasant surprise and artfully prepared.
Rating: Five stars

Service: The aervice was attentive.
Rating: Four stars

Atmosphere: The restaurant is pleasant and relaxing.
Rating: Five stars

Location: The location at The Mirage is convenient and accessible.
Rating: Four stars

"From the moment we walked into the Portifino Restauant in the beautiful Mirage Hotel, Las Vegas, everything about the evening was exceptional.  The ambience was inviting, the menu of food and wine was spectacular and the service was beyond 5 star!  Special thanks to General Manager Chris Zadie who went out of his way to ensure that my wife's birthday celebration was unforgettable, Chef Michael Laplaca who prepared delicious Italian dishes that were reminiscent of those we grew up on, including vegan specialties for my wife, and our waiter Kim, who executed all of our courses with finesse and expert timing.  Simply put it was one of the the finest dinning experiences of our lives. Molte Grazie"

Excellent service and delicious food. We went here for dinner before Cirque Du Soleil. We had originally planned on going to Samba, a Brazilian BBQ also located in The Mirage, but the thought of eating a bunch of BBQ then sitting in the theater all that time seemed a bit too much.
It was my son and I and we were given just as nice service as the larger groups at the tables around us. 
My son had the Thick Spaghetti with Oxtail and I had the Garlic Chilean Sea Bass. 
The bread and dipping oil was so good. 
We were so happy we chose to eat here instead.
It was just ok. They say it was voted best in Vegas, but I would really question that...

I appreciate that Portofino offers a vegetarian menu, which consists of adapted versions of its regular menu items. The Pappardelle alla Vodka was delicious, with perfectly cooked al dente fresh pasta and vegetables and some extra spiciness on request. Pasta and fagioli soup was flavorful and thick. The waiter's goofy one-liners (e.g., "sorry to see you didn't like that" in response to an empty plate) were more suited to a Macaroni Grille than a fine dining establishment, but other than that the service was good and attentive. Bill for two people, including appetizers, two drinks each and dessert was about $200. Nice atmosphere, and the location is completely set off from the casino environment. This is a good choice for a special occasion meal.

Came here with the girlfriend after seeing Love by Cirque De Solei (good show, not a bad seat in the house). We had a reservation at 9 and were immediately seated by our hostess. The waiter was quick to take our drinks and we had out water glasses filled immediately. Then we were given a long breadstick to nibble on and had a bread basket placed in front of us along with some bean paste. I think maybe just some old fashioned oil and vinegar would suit it much better. The bean paste was cold and it honestly just seemed wrong when you ate it with the bread. We started off with the antipasti which had some nice meats, cheeses, olives and pickled peppers with it. We decided to split a main course since we had spoiled some of our appetite before the show and chose the lasagna. The waiter said they would split it into separate dishes for us which was perfect. Each portion we had was perfect and actually rather large. The lasagna was served with the sauteed spinach (i think??) but it was WAAAY to salty. Overall the food was good, not great. But the service we had was wonderful. I just think they need to tone it down on the salt and for the love of all that is holy please get rid of the bean paste for the bread.

We went here because the restaurant we wanted to eat at didn't have any reservations and Portofino's was recommended. We are so happy it was recommended! Everything was amazing.. the food, the customer service, the ambiance. I ordered the gnocchi with frog legs! I usually wouldn't order frog legs but I decided to be adventurous and it was great! We had tickets to see Love so they made sure we were served in prompt time to make it to the show. Can't wait to eat here the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

We stopped in to eat while waiting for our show.  The waiter, Lito was awesome.  He suggested the Agnolotti as my dish and pasta fagioli for my friend, who didn't want a huge meal.  
Wow, I was totally surprised.  For starters, the fagioli was very good and filling.  My Agnolotti was outstanding as well.  Couldn't have ordered anything better myself.  Thank You Lito!!  I will definitely be back next time I come to town.

My friend and I visited Onda on a Saturday night after making reservations before our show. The decor was beautiful. The service was distracted because he had too many tables, one of which was a very loud and large bachelorette party seated very close to us. We ordered cocktails, and split a $14 caesar salad that was ok. Our entrees, however, were completely inedible. I ordered a $28 eggplant piccatta that was so drenched in butter, it was congealing on the plate. My friend ordered a $30 noodle dish witrh mushrooms that was also inedible, although I guess no flavor is better than drenched in butter. We would have said something to our server, but he didn't come back to check on us until we were ready for the check. Definitely regret spending one of our evenings in Vegas there.
Nice dinner with my husband.  The dressing on the Caesar salad was amazing!  I ordered the lobster pasta and it was fantastic.  We also had great service!

My husband and I had an anniversary dinner at Portofino. Our experience was amazing. We had exceptional service provided by Kim. He made the perfect suggestions for both wine and food. We started with the risotto appetizer. We were surprised when the chef came over and personally shaved white truffles over it. The risotto as perfect in taste and texture. We then shared the burrata agnolotti. The chef came by again to shave white truffles on it. Wow! It was so good. We ended with a special anniversary dessert presented gratis. The entire evening was so special for us. We would absolutely recommend this restaurant and hope to return again soon.

Everything was delicious service was very good 
The meatballs were amaZing only complaint I have was the food took a little long to come out.
But was worth the wait! Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

We celebrated my wife's birthday at Portofino; fantastic!
The staff was upbeat, informative and spot on.  The  "Crab Cake Arancini" was, by far, the best crab cake I have ever eaten; there was plenty of crab and the lemon saffron risotto binder brought all the flavors together magnificently. The veal saltimbocca with sage potato gratin, while not the traditional saltimbocca had all of the great flavor combinations  of  the traditional saltimbocca, but the veal could be enjoyed on its own.  My wife's branzino was perfectly cooked, presented and flavored.  You may think tiramisu is tiramisu, but this again was clearly a cut above. Enjoy!

The ambiance was nice and the service was impeccable. It definitely felt like a five star experience with the exception of the food. My husband and I each ordered a different veal dish, and both found the flavor to be off. I had the veal saltimbocca which is a thicker cut of veal and in this case, wrapped in prosciutto. It was just too tough for my enjoyment.

We had reservations at another restaurant but last minute changed to this one...we felt taken care of throughout the evening.. The crab cake appetizer is a must...
The food wait was a bit long but worth the wait..we had the lamb and was undecided on the other dinner.. The waiter offered to split dishes...the food was tasteful and I absolutely loved the bread!!!  One of the dishes may have been a little heavy handed on the salt.. But the waiter was gracious and comped it!! Nevertheless it was a good change.... I would recommend this restaurant !!!

DA EVITARE!
My husband is Italian and we just moved 2 years ago from Milan to the States. Portofino was by far the worst Italian restaurant we have been in a while.They try to modify traditional Italian plates to a more sophisticated version putting a high price label on it. We had the lasagne which was burned, cold and with ingredients that don't go with it. The spaghetti carbonara had a strange taste. The gnocchi were warmed up and not fresh at all.
The atmosphere is snob and tries to attract the rich ones thinking to find a great Italian spot. There are better places to spend your time and money.
One star because the wine was good. At least they know to choose the wine.
This is my favorite Italian in LV, I can't wait to go again.    Great atmosphere and good service. Try any of the veal dishes, they're all superb.    Good wine list.

We are locals and like ro try new places for girls night. We went off the good reviews, unfortunately. First off it took at least 20 min before the server asked us if we would like cocktails.  He was pretty much MIA the whole time. Bread basket finally arrives, but so disappointing.  Cold & dry. We barely had half a piece and pushed it to the side. 30 mins later we started on our appetizers. Calamari was average, octopus was decent.  Nothing memorable. For main course i had the burrata agnolotti and my friend had the chicken parmigiana.  The agnolotti was good, but not something i would crave or go back for....Not to mention it was warm at best! My friends chicken parm was a disaster.  Thick chunks of cold chicken in tomato sauce!! She asked for them to heat it up & they brought a new one out. Me & my friend had already finished our courses. For dessert we had the nutella creme brulee, which was very good & tiramisu was average.  The 3 of us agreed dinner was "ok", but we will not be back.

Excellent Italian food in a relaxing environment. The meatball appetizer tasted as good as my grandmother's from Sicily. The entrees were superb. I went with several other people and we all enjoyed the meal. Other highlights for our group included the Cesar Salad, the pasta faggioli soup, and the lobster tortellini. The prices were also good for being on the strip.
Tried something different.  Great service, great drinks, great food (chicken parmesan) tomato salad)... Would go back!

Good friends of ours were visiting recently from Paris and we all went out for Italian at Onda based on positive Yelp reviews. What a mistake!! One of our guests ordered the bass based on our waiter indicating its ample size. It arrived a shriveled 6 inches, flattened and dry. My pasta dish was very gummy with a Ragu type sauce and raw carrots! Everyone in our party was unimpressed. The service was also dreadful. We paid a platinum price for garbage! Never again.

Pedimos uma lula de entrada que estava deliciosa e suave com um molho marinara. De prato principal pedimos o Gnocci que estava muito bom, um dos melhores que já comi. Para fechar creme brulle!!! Imperdível!!

Portofino is our favourite restaurant in Vegas - hands down. 

It's not the food that's the best, it's not the atmosphere that's the best, it's the magical combination of everything that comes together to create an amazing experience. Every time my wife and I go down to Vegas, we usually do Thursday-Monday. Our "last supper" is always at Portofino in the Mirage. 

Favourite appetizers: Caprese Salad (unbelievably fresh and delicious), Meatballs (the goat cheese is a great touch, and the Arancini (huge chunks of crab with an amazing pesto aioli).

Favourite pasta: Ripatelli, closely followed by the Pork Cheek Ravioli. My wife absolutely loves the pasta special with lobster and white sauce they had on in late August when we were there last. 

Favourite Entrees: Dry boat scallops are ALWAYS perfectly cooked, and the Veal Osso Buco is incredible and flavourful, especially with the saffron risotto and bone marrow.

And don't forget to pick something from their extensive (and fairly priced) wine list, or try one of their many incredible cocktails. The service is also incredible. 

I'll tell anyone that will listen to try Portofino!

Amazing culinary experience! My husband and I decided to give this place a try since we always stay at The Mirage when staying in Las Vegas. What an amazing food experience. He tried the Chicken Parmesan which of course had the chef's twist. He absolutely loved it and devoured it. I tried the Fettucine Alfredo with red sauce, very fresh. Even their bread they serve before dinner does not disappoint. Will definately be going back again.

Tried this for the first time tonight. Perfect date spot. Nice atmosphere. Excellent service (Kim was our server). Amazing food. Don't miss the burrata and the lemoncello creme brûlée. 5 stars all the way.

AMAZING!!!! So so so so so good!! My mom, sister, and I stopped in before we saw a show and all loved our orders. I played it a little safe and got the spaghetti, my sister got the lasagna, and my mom got the burrata agnolotti. We all loved our meals and ate every single bite. The sauce for the spaghetti was so rich and flavorful and although I didn't try their selections my sister claimed it was the best lasagna she's ever tried. It is a little pricey but it's so worth it for the quality of the food and the great service. A must try if you're in Vegas!

Service was atrocious!! I am really surprised this restaurant has such a high rating?? The food was good (not amazing, but decent). Could have been a way better experience had the service been up to par!  I seriously receive better service at Olive Garden!  To many things wrong to list or explain here, but basically, if you expect to be waited on with out having to flag down your waiter after seriously giving him the benefit of the doubt (on several occasions - even when he hadn't stopped buy the table within the first 15 minutes of being seated, or check on us after apps or main course were delivered, or bringing us the check without asking if we wanted coffee/dessert) then DON'T  EAT HERE!!

Yummy!

Came here for a dinner date (blind date), it was very good.. there pasta's are good... as well as there sea food plates, service could of been a little better... but the food made up for it..........The only negative thing is me haveing such  a hidious date...


Blind Date's Stink!

Flight delayed. Arrived 10 minutes before closing and were greeted warmly. Treated us like friends really and helped us with the menu. The recommendation was spot on. We both at the lobster ravioli with cream sauce. It was absolutely to die for. Split a Caesar salad. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We did not feel rushed at all. Certainly one of the best Italian restaurants it has my Highest recommendation.

Just ate at Portofino's at the Mirage. One of the best dinners EVER. Chuck was great as our server, very knowledgable and personable. Chris Zadie, the General Manager, was absolutely WONDERFUL. His advise was spot on. The fact that they had Cakebread wine was a bonus. This will be a sure stop every visit.  Get the crab cake!!!
Wow. My wife had the salmon and popcorn and I knocked of the scallops. Both perfect with the octopus for a starter as well very nice.

Atmosphere was wonderful, very calm, quiet, beautiful restaurant in general.

Food/wine prices were on par with the rest of Vegas...

We had the lasagna and salmon. Holy crap. Freaking delicious.

Only weird moment was the photographers going around, trying to get people to buy picture packages of themselves.

I thought my meal at Onda was decent, but probably not worth the price.  For instance,  I ordererd the lasagna, which was absolutely delicious, but it certainly better be for $26 lasagna!  The bread and balsamic, with olive oil, tomato, and garlic was wonderfully done.  I notice a poster below thought the calamari was the worst they had in their life, but I thought it was okay.  Not great, but okay.  The decor is nice, nothing special, but nice.  If I craved Italian in Vegas again, I think I would ask for another opinion, because while good, I just dont feel we received the value for what we received.

Fantastic restaurant. Excellent service by the very knowledgeable JASON. He convinced most of us to get the Sicilian Mulo (well worth the $15). Definitely worth a try if you are staying/seeing something at the Mirage (or even just in general).

Vegas can depress you after a while, that's why my husband and I can only take it in 2-3 night bits before we have had enough. For our last night in town we decided to head to the lobby of the Mirage (where we're staying) for a dinner at what was reportedly the "best Italian restaurant in Vegas". Perhaps we are spoiled because of Boston's glorious North End, but if this is the best in Vegas, I'm very concerned. We selected the prix fix menu. My quail appetizer was great and made me eager for the next course. However, my main course literally looked and tasted like something one would find at a restaurant in a Holiday Inn. I could barely stomach it. The dessert wasn't much better. We left feeling like we'd been robbed. The decor and design of the restaurant was terrible compared to the swank competitors along the strip, and the elderly namedropping locals were nothing but annoying. Steer clear.

Filet Mignon...fucken delicious! melts in your mouth
The nut shots...strong and mmmmmmm
the anti pasto plate....goes great with the bread!!!!

We had a great time and service was awsome! I had the Capellini with Scallops, the scallops rocked!

The sauce was lite and tasted great. Try this one out, our party of 6 had a great time.

This review pains me a great deal, as Onda has the chance to be a top contender for my favorite restaurant, but I can't imagine trying it again as it was a very bad experience.

We made 9:30 reservations to enjoy a relaxed dinner on my wife's birthday after seeing Love.  We walked up to the hostess podium with another couple waiting and no one manning the station.  As the hostess comes back, an older man walks up and says table for two, clearly cutting in line.  She asks if they have a reservation, he says no, and they are sat immediately.  I didn't say anything to the hostess as it was apparent he was cutting and if he was sat immediately, I figured it would be just a minute or two.  She comes back and puts the couple in front of us down on the waiting list, they also had no reservation.  Next I check in with her and tell her we do have a reservation, but she says we have to wait.  VERY ANNOYING.

What I believe to be a manager then came to the podium while she was away and offered to seat us, ultimately having to stop in the middle when he saw that there wasn't a table.  Clearly the hostess gave our table to the line jumper without a reservation.  VERY ANNOYING.  He was friendly and professional and set us up at the bar and offered us a free drink (I don't drink and my wife is pregnant) so we just got a simple drink, but the gesture was excellent and we were ready to start over again with Onda.  After a few minutes, we were sat at a nice table and the seats were very comfortable (a bit too cushy for my wife, she had a hard time getting out since she was pregnant).

As it was, we ordered the two most expensive items on the menu, so expected top quality food.  I had the lobster milanese and can honestly say it was the best lobster that I ever had.  For those who don't like the breading exterior, just don't eat it all :-P.  My wife ordered ravioli, but it wasn't ravioli.  It was basically a flat noodle (as in lasagna) with some cream and seafood and another flat noodle.  I liked hers, but she didn't.  If that was all there was, it would easily be a 4 star experience.

The part that is unforgivable is that our waiter (Cesar) ignored us after taking our orders.  He didn't bring the food from the kitchen, he didn't refill our drinks, he didn't check in at all.  Worst of all, when he walked by our table, he looked the other way so we couldn't even flag him down.  At this point, the restaurant was mostly empty, as it was 10:30 or maybe a bit later.  Someone else took our plates and we sat there with no drinks and no food for around 30 minutes.  My wife wanted dessert, but was getting really annoyed at the actions of the waiter.  FINALLY, he came by and said "Is there a birthday here??" bringing a piece of cake.  He didn't seem to know whose birthday it was and he didn't give us the option to look at a dessert menu.  Yes, the slice of cake was free, but my wife didn't like it and would have happily paid for something she did enjoy.  She was very upset and not the experience I had hoped for when I am paying over $50/plate.  VERY ANNOYING!!

I still tipped reasonably well under the circumstances (15%) because in Vegas I am very superstitious and didn't want bad karma :-P.  I looked for the manager who was so friendly and the busboy? who had been refilling our drinks and clearing our plates to tip them a $20 directly for their service, but didn't see them.

For a place with such excellent food that I would love to try again, I can't imagine coming back after terrible, inept service, especially when we were celebrating a special occasion that they knew about.

Onda, please class it up.

Very nice meal! I was looking for something on the light side. I settled upon the rockfish, and I'm glad I did! A very nice piece of fish! The large party I was with decided to eat there before the Beatles show, and it was a perfect evening at the Mirrage! Nice wines and very well prepared foods!

We stopped by here last minute on our way to Boyz II Men. Service started out really slow but we mentioned we were in a rush and everything was very quick after that. It's a comfortable restaurant with lots of space. I ordered the pork ravioli which was amazing and I'd definitely order it again. You won't be disappointed!

The waiter was helpful in letting us know which dishes we shouldn't order if we wanted our meals to come out quickly. He was attentive in filling our waters and was very friendly.

Italian food located inside the MIrage. Niiiice.
There were a ton of restaurants to choose from in the Mirage but we settled for expensive expensive Italian food. 

The front area of Onda consisted of a little wine lounge. Just a place to relax and do some wine tasting. The actual restaurant is in the back of this place. The bread they gave us was typical, but the dipping sauce they provided was amazing! It was a mixture of olive oil, vinagarette, diced tomatoes, and roasted garlic cloves. Mmm!!

Here's what we ordered

CALAMARI
I wouldn't recommend it. The calamari was lightly fried but it didn't have the crunch I like with calamari. The calamari was indeed soft and fresh though.

LASAGNA
HUGE hunk of lasagna but priced at $26? I guess I won't order this again. I could barely finish this but the veal and pork that it was stuffed with was delicious.

OSSO BUCCO
A huge huge shank served on top of cheesey risotto rice. Yum! They even give you a fork to dig out the bone marrow in this veal shank. Ewwww! 

All in all, I enjoyed our dinner. We opted out on wine because we were too tired already so for the calamari, lasagna, and osso bucco, it came up to about $75 total. Not bad for a fine dining restaurant like this in Vegas, but will I come back? Probably not. It's a one time deal place.

Had a pretty decent meal here, and prices were reasonable for being on the strip. Caprese Salad was good, Scallops were good, Meatballs were good, service was excellent. 

Only 3-stars because the bread was very mediocre. Not sure how to describe it but it wasn't really a typical italian bread, it had no crust and some of the pieces were crunchy on the outside like they had been sitting in a warmer for too long. I didn't think it was bad per se but I would have liked a little variety. Whenever I'm eating Italian, French or Spanish food, the bread is so important. It would probably be a simple fix, and if they just offered a little variety in their breads I would probably give this 5 stars.

Move over Tom Colicchio,
      Move over Emeril
         and Giada???? just pack it in....there's a new chef in town, Michael LaPlaca~

If you want Italian, I suggest you head over to Portofino, inside the Mirage. Fresh pasta made daily that melts in your mouth along with house made gravy (or sauce to us none paisans!) that you wish your mama made for those Sunday night family meals.

We enjoyed dinner @ Portofino's on Friday and there was NOT one misstep the entire evening. Our server, Sheri was friendly, conversational and best of all not intrusive. Her Server Assistant, Max was a pleasure. The GM, Chris greeted our table, was chatty which we liked PLUS has the ability to describe Chef LaPlaca's food into mouthwatering deliciousness ~ 

For appetizers the crab cake arancini (a house special) is not to be overlooked ~ pan seared to light, chrispy perfection & easily shared for 2 without feeling cheated. Next DO NOT overlook the Kobe beef & Deruta pork meatballs w/ a ricotta stuffed squash blossom in house made marinara sauce. OH DEAR LORD!!!! simply just the BEST EVER!!!! Yeah, Yeah, Yeah, I know Rao's is the  supposed meatball king of the LV Strip.....That being said the judges must not have tried Chef LaPlaca's cuz there is NO COMPARISON....... REALLY!!!

Let's get to the pasta ~  You'll think your in Italy. It is that (expletive!) good!
     Start with at least a half order to share of the Burrata  Agnolotti....Lobster, chanterelle mushrooms and parmesan butter, really how bad could this be???  you will NOT be disappointed and the full order will not allow you to enjoy the rest of your meal, even tho you will want more trust me on this~ DON'T!

Your main course.....I don't think you can go wrong with any selections on the menu. 
        We started with the Veal Osso Bucco ~ soft fatty marrow goodness set in saffron risotto all floating covered with rich, decadent veal sauce.

        Next selection, the Gnocchi ~  soft "melt in your mouth" potato pillows resting with forest mushrooms, arugula, a drizzle of creamy truffle fonduta finished w/ parmigiano reggiano.

       Our final entree' selection had to be "traditional" Italian fare so the Chicken Rollatini Parmesan~ presented deconstructed with house made marinara & melted mozzarella. Pretty to look at & deeeelish to the palate.

      Cappuccinos for dessert along with Tiramisu AND Cannoli (also served deconstructed) presented with citrus olive oil ice cream (sounds odd, but really, really good!) 

  All this heavenly food along with 2 bottles of Ferrari-Carano made for a dining experience fit for the 12 Roman Gods and there were only 4 of us~

It was 10:00 pm, and I just woke up from my nap.  I decided to go downstairs to try what Las Vegas Concierge Association proclaims as the "Best Italian Restaurant."  Sitting in the restaurant section, the service was attentive and the ambiance was mellow.  

We started off with an order of half a dozen oysters (I believe we had Blue Point), only to be served with five.  It was a funny mistake, but corrected without any hesitation from the waiter by giving us three more oysters.  I ordered the Penne with Crab, Shrimp and Scallops.  The dish was good, but I was expecting more than just a couple pieces of crab.  However, my friend ordered the lamb chops, and it was cooked to melt in your mouth perfection.  

We ended our dinner with a $7 Tiramisu which was definitely large enough for three to share and maybe even four.  If you prefer quantity over quality, then this is the desert I would go for.  

This is a place that I would go back to again, and next time I HAVE to order the lamb chops.

I have a mix feeling about this place. 1st service is good but my problem is the food. We ordered a Crab cake as Appetizers that was good so our expectation is high. However, for entree, we had LASAGNA and Iron beef something( I forgot the name). LASAGNA is very salty and I couldn't even finish it. When waiter came to check on us, we did tell him the entree was very salty. He asked us how to make it right...how could you make a entree right when it is too salty? ...maybe cancel my order or something but they didn't....

However, when they took away our entrees, we over heard that people sitting next to us also complaint their foods are too salty.

The service was amazing, but I am Pollitarian, so I don't eat beef or pork and I'm lactose intolerant.  I advised them no meat or dairy.  The calamari they put the parm on the side for my friend, which was tender and delicious.  Best I've ever had.  The issue was my meal.  It came with prosciutto and Parma, which I requested not be on my plate.  They even split two different plates for my friend, so they are very accommodating.  Mine ended up with the pork on it, I was watching and started feeling funny, I finally picked through the bellpeppers,and there was the pork.  I ran through the restraunt, to get I'll.  They did comp our food, but they do need to be more cautious.  My friends plate has no pork, so I assume, that I got hers.  Note:  we had an issue using a m-life rewards, but the manager graciously allowed us to use it, because we were told we could, even though it was a holiday weekend.  My only complaint would be I never got to eat dinner and caution when you have special dietary needs.  I see from another review, they do have  vegetarian menu, which I was never offered.

The ambience, like all decent Vegas restaurants was nice. I loved the breadsticks they gave us, but the bean puree was not popular with anyone in our party. I wish I had waited til we got butter because it was much better with all the bread than that bean stuff. We ordered a bottle of wine (note that the wine list does not have a guiding line over to the prices, and the prices didn't seem to be in strict ascending order as I recall, because there was a little bit of confusion when the bill came as to the price of our bottle) which was nice. 

My bf got the all-you-can-eat mussels which you can get with either white sauce or red. He got a couple of each and they were pretty good and well worth $20 for AYCE. I had the chicken parmesan and was pleased with the portions. The rabe was pretty good though salty, and the pasta was just pasta (not fresh made or anything) but had a good sauce on it. I sampled the lasagna which was good, and the gnocchi which I almost wish I'd ordered. The bill was not bad at all and we had a good time.

My first experience here and I most definitely want to visit again! We had the best waiter, Sam, not sure his last name but he was absolutely the nicest waiter I've ever had. The service was fast and everyone was nice! I definitely recommend eating here for anyone!!  Definitely A++ service
If you have the pleasure of coming here, ask for Sam, he did everything he could to make our diner the best it could be, even with our complicated orders.
Got some great service here from our waiter.  Choose the fish it was delicious. It was whole (no head) crispy skin.  Came with mushrooms that were soooo good

We had dinner here for a friends birthday which started off on a bad start. No body approached our table after we were seated because we had brought our own wine and the servers thought we were already taken care of since we had a bottle on our table. After bringing it to their attention the staff was very apologetic and even took half of the price off for the cork fee (50 bucks). 

I had the fettuccine Alfredo which was very sub par to the rest of our party's  food. It was bland and it tasted like anyone could have made it. $32 for bland chicken Alfredo? Cmon.  Birthday boy had the lasagna which reminded me of barbacoa with marinara and cheese... Mexican styled lasagna? Hmmm... The one dish that surprised all of us was the Gnocchi! The vegetarian of our group ordered herself the Gnocchi and couldn't have been happier with her choice. I tried it myself and remember it being delicious but dont remember it enough to describe as it wasn't my meal.

I'd be open to come again but definitely won't be getting anything we ordered tonight.

The atmosphere was beautiful and very intimate and the staff was very friendly and well educated on their food and wine which was pretty cool.

For my friends birthday they brought out some BOMB tiramisu! Probably the best tiramisu I've ever had. Perfectly moist and had just the right amount of chocolate, coffee, and creme.

In all, Portofino was a great restaurant but not worth the price point. We knew it was going to be pricey and we were fine with it but the quality of food wasn't as good as we thought it would have been.

Service was excellent from entrance to exit.   Entrees?  Not so much.

Have you ever sat around a table talking and when the food arrives, everyone just keeps talking?  Nary a word about what has been placed in front of them.  It has been two weeks since we dined and no one has ever said a word about their food.

I ordered one of the night's specials, Short Rib Ravioli.
(sigh)
The "short rib" came as ground meat and just a scant dollop at that.  Afterward, I remember sitting in the Love Theatre thinking, "what did we just spend money on".

With four diners, the bill was substantial.  The food was not.

Excellent food, but taking off a star for the unnecessarily exclusive, transparently dishonest Vegas bullsh*t from the black-clad bouncer babes outside the front door ("sorry, but we can't seat you in our nearly-empty restaurant; no available reservations until 9:30 p.m.").

We sat at the bar, after being told by the aforementioned hostesses (there's a pair of these outside every restaurant in Vegas now, pretending with varying degrees of snottiness that nearly-empty restaurants are all booked up) that all of the tables around us that would remain empty the entire night were "reserved."  In the 2.5 hours we dined at the bar, finally leaving about 10:30 p.m., the restaurant remained mostly empty, even on a Friday night; there were perhaps three other couples in the entire restaurant.  "No reservations available" my ass.  Like most Strip restaurants, the stampede of diners that the black-frocked bouncers want you to think are coming to lend cachet to their establishment does not actually exist.  Maître d's be frontin', for the most part.

I ordered a roasted salmon entrée, served atop a round of mushroom polenta, with peas in a creamy, rich green sauce made with pureed peas and herbs.  The salmon was tender and generous; the mushroom polenta rich and wonderful (in spite of the fact that I'm not a fan of mushrooms, umami triumphed over the slimy, moldy, fungal flavor of mushrooms that's usually a turnoff for me), and the sauce and peas fresh, grassy, and marvelous.  My companion had their signature variant on chicken Parmesan, a "rollatini" of chicken breast, pounded and rolled around pork sausage and Parmesan cheese, then crumbed and baked.  The red sauce for the rollatini chicken Parmesan was a creamy, cheesy delight, deceptively light and fresh when you know it's surreptitiously clogging your arteries.

We finished up with Nutella crème brulee and their variant of cannoli, with scoops of lemon and vanilla frozen custard, cracker-sized chips of crisp cannoli shell, and chocolate drizzle.  Both of these were among the best desserts I've eaten anywhere; the Nutella crème brulee was a sublime showstopper.

Like restaurants in Italy, you'll have to tell the waiter that you need your check if you ever want to get out of here.  Service is languid here, like in the old country.

What can I say, this place is simply magic! And let me tell you why. THE SERVICE was excellent. This is a nice restaurant with large portions and delicious handmade pasta that is very reasonably priced especially for Vegas! The lobster agnolotti was fluffy and light and extremely tasty! 

The manager, Chris was extremely gracious and helpful when it came to picking a bottle of wine. We went with an Amarone (mind blowing). Finally we were there celebrating a birthday and the staff were more than hospitable, they went above and beyond! Sam, Manuel and Lito, you guys are incredible and made us feel at home! Thank you for your generosity and sincerity- you were the highlight of our evening!! 

We will be back!

Would recommend many others places in Vegas and on this trip I had a chance to try four restaurants in four nights, and Onda was my least favorite.

The restaurant is in the Mirage, which is where they hold the Beatles "Love" show by Cirque du Soleil. The hotel is a bit dated and a bit smokier than the new hotels.

On to Onda - it's a traditional Italian restaurant. 

The app was the best part - Prosciutto w/ Parmiagano and 25 yr old balsamic.

The entree was Olive Garden - Ordered Ravioli stuffed with Lobster and Shrimp served in a Broccoli Rabe Puree...I thought it would be significantly lighter than what came out - Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli in a heavy buttery cream sauce that puts you straight to bed.

The service overall was a letdown based on what I expect in Las Vegas, even from an older hotel. We had a group of eight, three separate times had to motion a waiter over for service.
I thought this restaurant was great! I has the sweet pea ravioli with my sweet pea BF before going to see LOVE. It was very nice!

This was one of the best dining experiences that I have EVER HAD!!! We let them know that it was our anniversary and that we were seeing a show that was starting in a little over an hour. THE ENTIRE STAFF WENT WAY OUT OF THEIR WAY TO SEE TO IT THAT WE MADE IT ON TIME AND THAT WE STILL HAD A WONDERFUL MEAL!!
The food was amazing!! atmosphere, seervice, EVERYTHING was FIRST CLASS!!
You won't be sorry....

My girlfriend and I had made reservations at Portofino for Sunday January 11th, two weeks prior to that date.  We were very excited and had procured a buy one get one entree coupon as well as having a dining credit with the Mirage hotel (where Portofino is located) so we were excited to have a fancy dinner together.  

We got all dressed up and headed down stairs for our dinner and upon reaching the restaurant, there was no one at the host stand.  We walked up the stairs and looked in to the restaurant, no one was in there, no staff, no customers, no sign posted, only what the hours and days of operation were that indicated that the restaurant should be open.

Through our own detective work we found out that the restaurant decided to change their hours and just decided not to contact people (or at least us) with reservations to notify them.

We were obviously upset and I can't believe that they would treat their prospective patrons this way, I can't imagine how i would feel if this attitude is how they treat their customers in the restaurant.

Very dissapointed.
Everything was excellent.  We went for the happy hour and the value cannot be beat.

We had wanted to try Onda last December when we were in Vegas only to find out it was closed to renovations.  We were finally able to get there this trip and it was quite good.

We were seated in a booth in the main dining room which is done in soft gold tones with low lighting.   It is very romantic and homey, as if you are dining at a family restaurant in Little Italy, albeit an upscale one.  (It is the exact opposite of N9NE...see N9NE review.) The tomato, garlic and olive oil they give you with your bread was fantastic and the bread was very fresh and fluffy.  My husband and I split the caprese salad as an appetizer, which I would highly suggest...they split it in half for us and it was the perfect size.  (And the mozzarella was very good.)  For an entree I had the capellini with scallops which were very good, well cooked, and in a generous serving.  The pasta was well cooked and they used a good amount of oil on it, not too much that it made it slippery and hard to eat but enough to give it flavor.  My friend ordered the fettuccine alfredo which he said was out of this world.

Tucked away in the back of the Mirage, Onda proved to be a great dining experience.

Portofino was amazing! I will get to the spectacular food next but what elevated  this restaurant was the world class service.  Starting with William at the bar who will make your favorite drink and make you feel like a friend for years. The hostess appeared at the right moment to escourt us to our table. The decor is classic elegance with a touch of an old world feel.  The menu has lots of delicious sounding choices and the waiter greeted us promptly. However when Chris came by our table, the meal went from dinner to a fine dining experience. Chris was an expert on the menu and thrilled us with his explanation of the dishes. He solved our ordering delimma by offering split plates so we could have all our heart's desired. Chris is also the sommelier and paired the perfect wine with our order. We are almost exclusively red wine drinkers but his recommendation of a delicious white wine from Italy elevated the food. And the food was spectacular! The pasta was fresh with decadent lobster and a sauce that makes you want to lick your plate. The scallops were huge, sushi grade and the best I have ever eaten. The dishes are unique flavor combinations that dance on your palette. It's not on the menu but the chef makes an outstanding carbonara. If there is anything you want don't hesitate to ask because every dish is made to order and their outstanding chef can make anything. The portion size is huge so we didn't have room for dessert. The amazing food and service made our evening spectacular. We would definitely recommend that you visit soon as this restaurant is slated to be closed which is heartbreaking!  So hurry and see Chris and his team for a truly evelavated dining experience.

First off, I enjoyed the separate vegetarian menu. While finding vegetarian fare at an Italian restaurant is fairly commonplace - the effort put in to create a specialized menu was much appreciated. My only qualm with the vegetarian menu is that I wish the portions were slightly larger or more substantive - it seems like they just took out the meat from certain entrees. For an upscale Italian restaurant, they could have easily substituted the meat with mushrooms or a different kind of protein/cheese.  
From that vegetarian menu, I ordered the Ripatelli. The Sommalier was raving about the Ripatelli, claiming that visitors from all over the world ask for it by name. I'm not sure about all that, but I like that everyone from the waiter to the somm was attentive and engaged with my table of 5. 
The Ripatelli certainly tasted fresh. But I feel that the dish is nothing more than an innovative marketing ploy to use up all the leftover scraps of pasta. Nonetheless, the pasta was adorned with asparagus and other seasonal vegetables and had a good salty flavor with the addition of goat cheese. I was able to finish my entire plate. 
I also had a taste of my friend's Tiramisu and it was pretty good. 
 
The place was fairly crowded considering it was a Friday dinner. My party had made reservations prior and we only had to wait 5 minutes before being seated. 

Overall, the atmosphere seemed to be large group-friendly and jovial. A good place to catch up with friends over an upscale dinner suited to all diets.

I sent my kid sister and friend here as a gift.  There was a glitch with my prepayment, just one of those things, and it would really have taken the gloss off the evening.  But the owner, exercising what I would call great personal judgment, made it work smoothly without bothering them.  That is the kind of care you got in Vegas in years past.  They raved about their meals and their service, and got a real kick out of talking with Chris.  I am grateful.

Miker

Rounding up here.  It's really a 3.5. The good is good but not top caliber Italian. I had the burrata. The lobster was minimal, the sauce was good but it became incredibly buttery after a few bites. I guess eat it in moderation. We also has the bone marrow for an appetizer and the sardines that accompanied it were very good. Overall super over priced for what it is. Service was friendly.

This place is a nice fancy place to go to after a show, the place has a great look, and they have a good staff. The food overall was a bit salty. I had the rigatoni bolognese and that was really good, other people in my party had other things and complaint about the salt. The Osobuco is a big portion and a good pick to share. The food wasnt the greatest overall but the staff was nice, and efficient.

My husband and I visited on sat night. We ordered a bottle of wine.  The first one we ordered they were out of but we enjoyed our second choice.  We ordered the sardines and bone marrow appetizer along with the meatballs. The sardines were fabulous, the bone marrow was good but when they split it only one side had marrow in it. The meatballs were wonderful!  We then ordered the lamb ragu with homemade pasta and our last course was the Branzino.  The fish was salty and a little over cooked but the pasta course was outstanding.

Went there before Love by Beatles show at Mirage. Originally wanted to go to Fin, a chinese cuisine with great reviews, but they are table-only without a bar so I couldn't courage myself to go as I was by myself. I looked through other options at the hotel and at the very end of the restaurant hallway did I found Onda. I was drawn into it because of risotto on the menu (I'm a sucker for risotto) and they had a very nice, welcoming yet classy bar that I could sit by myself comfortably.  I really liked their decor and layout.  Not noisy at all unlike other options that you have at Mirage (I passed Kokomo, Japonais, and Stack for having loud party music and noisy crowd. ) 

The food was great, actually. I ordered Risotto Con Guance Di Manzo (TENDER BRAISED BEEF CHEEKS & RISOTTO | NATURAL JUS | MASCARPONE). First bite, yummy, excellent.  The beef cheek was SUPER tender you could cut with a fork. Risotto was perfect. I wasn't drinking but I had to order a glass of red wine because the dish deserved it. After halfway through the dish, though, the saltiness and richness of the dish started tasting too much. I think the beef cheek was too salty and the jus was helping it neutralizing, but the problem was that there wasn't enough jus for the huge chunk of meat.  Maybe it's just me. I could imagine my fiance would finish this easily, totally satisfied. 

Overall experience was good and I don't regret that I went there, but I don't know I will particularly choose to go back when I'm in town again. Also, the bartender, I think, was new and was a bit slow and wasn't very knowledgeable neither of food menu and wine. For what they charge, shouldn't everybody in the restaurant be trained enough to tell you what wine goes well with what dish, and also explain all the items in the menu, before they are allowed on the floor? (I overheard the bartender answering "bread" when he was asked what pancetta was. Come on now.)   For that I have to give 3 stars instead of 4.

I consider myself an Italian Cuisine Connoisseur.  This place deserve credibility.  My wife and I came to Vegas for business and happened to stay at the Mirage.  I might just come back to Vegas for Portofino alone.  

Rocco and Chuck were delightful.  My wife is incredibly picky and a challenge to serve because of her choice and food allergies.  Rocco was incredibly patient and caring and took the extra time to make sure she would not regret her decision.  Exemplary service.  If I could only get this back home regularly.

Started off with vegetarian Pasta Fagioli.  Yes sir!  Yumm yumm yumm.  Not heavy, very light flavorful explosion.

Then I had the Chick Parm.  A spin off of the original.  Hit my top 3 of all time.  Compliments to the chef!

Keep it up Portofino.  This place is the great for the price and offers incredible flavors of the truest Italiono dining.
Amazing food! The salmon was divine. Absolutely a restaurant if your in vegas you  must try;-) Nice ambience and great service. I will be back!

We really were not going to go out for fine dining at all, but we won so much money I thought it would be nice to treat my wife to another nice restaurant... we had eaten at Craft Steak House (MGM) the night before and just like last time it was delish...

Back to Onda....  We were gambling in Mirage and were hungry and decided to hit Onda.  

Service - AMAZING.  Waiters and greeters alike were all so wonderful and very helpful.  My wife and I honestly felt like royalty.

Food - OMG!!!! OMG!!!! OMG!!!!  Hands down one of the best meals I have ever had... not in Vegas, but period.

We started out with the Beef Carpaccio and it was divine.   I had the Veal for dinner and it was really good, but what was amazing was my wife's Osso Bucco.  It is her absolute favorite meal and they did not disappoint at all.  I had several bites and it melted in your mouth... OMG it was to die for... not to mention the portion size was rather large.

The price is a little on the expensive side, but not too expensive compared to other fine dining in Vegas.

Perfection! 
Service was incredible. 
Food was outstanding. 
Deserts were orgasmic! 

Thank you for the incredible experience. Can't wait to come back!

Excellent food and excellent service! I had an amazing experience here!!! Italian fine dining in an intimate and romantic setting. Highly recommended for love birds. The menu has been recently revamped and I had the pleasure of pretty much trying the entire new menu. It was like a banquet setup for Marie Antoinette. For me so this review is biased considering not everyone will have the same experience. Did I mention they found my one weakness: TRUFFLE. So of course I'm going to absolutely think it's great, I was spoiled out of my mind.

Generally speaking the notable items on my 20 course venture: 

PASTAS are the bomb here!!!
Carbonara with Australian Truffle 
Caviar fettuccine with Australian Truffle 

Grilled Bronzino (YUM) 

Caprese Salad - simplicity at its best! 

 Service is definitely 5 of 5

Will only add more glowing remarks on Portofino with Chef Michael LaPlaca.  His meatballs are spectacular, as are his pastas.  The room is beautiful, the service perfect, the wine is delicious!  Just exactly what you want and need.  We thought it was worth every dollar, and was priced right.
Wife and I wanted a great Italian meal on our last night in Vegas. The food and service especially by our waiter Kim was incredible. Thanks for making our last night memorable

Great place with incredible food. However, the service was what really shines at this place. It's obvious they care about their customers and the overall experience. Our server Rocco was kind, professional and knowledgeable. If you come here, request him. Also Rafael did an incredible job and was kind and on point. Great place! Definitely will come again!! Lastly - order the meatball app. Seriously, you must

This was our first time ever dining at Portofino. We were invited for my friends 40th birthday & had a party of 16. We were immediately greeted when arrived & were able to grab a drink at the bar upon arrival while waiting for the rest of the party. The bartender was great, very friendly & personable, the drinks were excellent As our party all arrived, we were seated immediately & introduced to our waiter. Since we were a larger party, the menu was already chosen for us by the host. Our meal consisted of 4 courses. As each course was served, our jaws dropped from the presentation, the selection & especially the taste. Our four courses consisted of at least 10 different dishes the restaurant served, all were so flavorful & amazing! From the Crab Cakes, Gnocchi, Meatballs, Calamari to the Caprese, our entire table was in awww with every bite! The Lobster Burrata Agnolotti has to be ONE OF THE BEST dishes I have ever had. Numerous people in our party said the same....This is a MUST HAVE if your trying to decide what to eat here.

Portofino earned every star! To top off the amazing food, waiters & bartender, the manager Chris & Chef Michael came to our table a few times to explain the dishes & to see if we needed anything. The customer Service & the fact that they went above & beyond in hospitality, I give this place an A++. We WILL make sure to go back every time we visit Vegas!

We've been here before and I've posted reviews before but I must say the quality of this place continually goes in the wrong direction.  It's still very nice to see when you walk in and the staff is very pleasant.  However, our server although nice, was speaking from a script.  We were first on the list and thought wow, he's charming and really interacting - then we heard him say the exact same things to every person within hearing distance.  Not a good idea if you're trying to make diners feel special.

Then there's the food.  It's supposed to be rustic Italian whatever that is.  My husband had lasagna and he said there was one lasagna noodle in the dish and the flavor was pretty bland.  I had Veal Osso Bucco, absolutely horrible.  While the veal was tender, the risotto was flavored with saffron, so much so that it left a nasty after taste in my mouth.  

Nothing exciting dessert wise so we didn't even bother.  We go here because it's in the hotel, not making that mistake again.
Excellent!  Great service, a subdued but beautiful decor, and fantastic food.  Try the meatballs for an appetizer, then the lobster burrata and the wild boar bolognese as entrees...all amazing!
I don't usually care for Italian food but after a meal here I my mind might be changing. Every dish was great and we all left stuffed with delicious food.

We went there before going to our show. The ambiance was cozy and our server was really nice. 
We had our food served to us really fast, it was delicious. 
The wine served was perfect to the table and reasonably priced. Their dessert: ice-cream covered with an expresso was soooo good! I still can taste it :D

I can't say enough about the branzino! I really do love this place too. My boyfriend loves me enough to bring me here every Vegas trip and it's becoming a new tradition. I never had a taste for cooked fish until I accidentally ordered the branzino on my first visit here two years ago. My boyfriend ordered the lamb. It was perfect as well. Although it is a fine dining establishment, you'll see people dressed casual (let's face it, it is Vegas). Service is great but when they're busy you'll need practice patience. The food is so good it overshadows the tiny flaws. Until next time Portofino!

Food
1. Was this a bad day for Portofino?  
2. Soft dinner bread basket offered with menu, this was good and easy to fill up on since it is so yummy.  Wish this trend continued.
3. Chicken rollatini parmesan: A sommelier/manager type figure came to talk to us.  Very enthusiastic about the food.  He described this dish as the most popular and for those who love chicken parmesan.  When it arrived, the food was luke warm or colder.  Essentially it is a few pieces of chicken breast stuffed with dark thigh/leg meat and seasoned, topped with marinara and cheese.  It just didn't agree with me and had a faint taste of "refrigerator" freon lingering.  It sort of made me queasy.  They took it back to "heat" up and came back a little warmer but dried up.  Not so great.
4. Family ordered day boat scallops and lamb.  They ate it all, mostly
5. Pasta Fagioli soup: Like a bean soup, taste similar to new England clam chowder to me.
6: Dessert: gelato trio - well this was the best part of the meal.  Felt like the sorbet and gelato helped to cleanse the palate.  
7. Kiss the Ring cocktail: almost called it "kiss the rim" - this was introduced as a signature cocktail of Johnnie Walker, Disaronno, luxardo Maraschino Cherry liquer, and chocolate bitters.  It sounded like it was going to be all my favorites: cherry, almond, and chocolate but tasted so harsh!  Luckily the sommelier offered to take it off the bill because no one at the table could tolerate a sip

Service
1. I really hope they hire a new hostess, checking in for our RESERVATION, felt like the typically snooty receptionist.  Sort of rolled her eyes as she turned around to guide us to our table and almost scoffed at our reservation.  Bad first impression and not friendly.
2. Other than the first encounter with the sommelier, the remaining service all occurred with a whole bunch of different bussers.  They sort of refilled drinks, brought out food, refilled water, and brought sauces.  One companion on the visit asked for Tabasco sauce for the soup/scallops and the busser seemed to imply that they have one bottle and he'd have to go hunt it down.  I don't consider good service being told what a "hassle" it is to assist the customer with what they need.  If you need to "hunt" something down then please keep that to yourself or I suppose lie and say that you don't have that at all.  Otherwise you're just making the guest feel like they are a burden.
3. Desserts were offered as free since the chicken was cold.  

Ambiance
1. Classic elegance, traditional vegas steak house feel with table cloths.  I feel this place tailors to an older generation, by the looks of the other guests eating here.  

Overall
1. I wanted to like this place as it was (as other reviewers mentioned) an Italian dining choice at the Mirage prior to our show.  
2. I want to chalk it up to a bad night here, maybe it would be better at a future visit, service and food....

This dining experience was phenomenal.  The food, service, ambiance and staff were all amazing.  We had an hour before a show and they got us in and out like it was fast food...but this was homemade top to bottom.  The focacia bread, risotto crab cake, ravioli...oh it was all worth every penny!  We can't wait to return.

Portofino had such great reviews so we decided to try it since we were seeing a show at The Mirage and we both love Italian food. The wine selection is great but that is about it. My fiancé ordered a beer which came in a can and a bottle of water was in a plastic bottle. I would expect more from a nice restaurant. The worse was the fact that I ordered the grilled octopus and specifically asked our server about the dish before ordering. He did not mention that the dish was served with pieces of ham in it nor did the menu. I eat seafood but have not had meat in over 8 years. He apologized after I had taken a bite of it. The dish was taken off our bill but can't take back the fact that I ate meat because of the lack of them not placing it on the menu. Now I find out from another review here that they had a separate vegetation menu. I would have loved for someone to had offered that menu to me last night. I will not be coming back here. It was a bad start to our suppose to be a very fun evening for us.

Onda was an unexpected delight, a real winner. We booked the show Love at the Mirage, and wanted dinner beforehand at the Mirage. Since I like Italian, we tried Onda. First, the room was beautiful, with a wood ceiling, great booths, and a very nice floral arrangement. I ordered the Caprese, Veal Saltimbocca, and Tiramisu. My wife is a vegie, and she went with a vegie dish especially prepared for her, with gluten free pasta. I have to say the Veal was outstanding, and I am a veal guy. Rather than the usual flattened scaloppini,  the veal was prepared as two larger tenderloins, wrapped in Prosciutto, and served with Spinach Coulis, Sage Potatoes, and au jus. Fabulous. The wines and beer were excellent. The service was very top rate. From Alpha to Omega, Onda hit a home run. I cannot overstate this: first rate food, first rate service, the best Veal Saltimbocca ever. I was especially impressed that Onda had a gluten free dish for my wife. They clearly aim to please, and they succeed.

The meatballs were some of the best I have ever had and having a goat cheese stuffed squash blossom was excellent and a nice, different touch.  Both meals were excellent.  The chef even came out to chat for a minute which was nice.  The service was good but we had 5 or 6 waiters, most asking us the same thing.  It was a little confusing

The food was beautiful and the waiter's assistant was really nice and eager. However, everything else was pretty bad. The cocktails were sub-par. I expect a place like this to use real lime juice, not bottled. The food looked good, but did not taste good.

Arroncini - the crab didn't taste fresh. No balance here--strong acid and rather greasy. Very one-note.

Burrata Agnolotti - lobster was slightly over cooked, but the pasta was good. The sauce, however, was far too overpowering and hid all other flavors. It just tasted like sharp cheddar, oddly. It would have been mediocre at even Olive Garden.

Day Boat Scallops - Very pretty, well cooked, but bland and nothing special.

The restaurant had only 6 tables in use at rush time, and the servers still didn't remember components of the specials and put the items at the wrong customers.

All in all, this was a meal that, at Olive Garden or similar, would have been just okay. For where and what it is, it was pretty disgraceful. I regret this meal.

This place is absolutely amazing! Food is UNREAL and the service is incredible! If you are looking for fresh, authentic Italian this is the spot. I had the Meatballs, Bolognese, Crab Cakes, Beet Salad, Gnocchi and Creme Brûlée. Each dish was perfectly crafted and the portions were perfect as well. I know where I'll be eating again when I'm back in Vegas.

I really need to start following my instincts. I can usually tell within 2 minutes if I'm going to have to endure crappy service. But, I usually wind up giving it the benefit of the doubt and I stay. A good indicator of this is when the restaurant is half empty but you still don't get any service for 5-10 minutes, and when you do, the waiter tells you he didn't know you were his table. I really should get in the habit of walking out once my indicators go off. Maybe that will be my New Years Resolution. 
We went on Sunday night, around 8:30pm. We were seeing "O" at Bellagio at 10:30 and figured it would be a good choice. Food alone, the place is probably 4 stars. The garlic mixture with the bread is quite tasty, my boyfriend enjoyed his caprese salad. The prosciutto wrapped prawns were deliciously salty. My sweetpea ravioli was something totally different and really good. The one miss was my boyfriend's pork roast. Some parts were amazingly delicious, and other parts were dry and inedible. Go figure. 
The service really brought the place down. Maybe our server had a long and hard day, who knows. We had to ask for bread, he forgot my order, disappeared for ten minutes at a time, forgot my dessert, and had to be flagged down for the check. Somewhat forgivable in a busy place, but again, that wasn't the case. 
Our bill was about $130 for the two of us. 2 apps, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, no alcohol. Considering how many fantastic restaurants are on the strip, I wouldn't go back.

This review is a few months past due, excellent experience at Portofino in the Mirage. Called ahead to let them know my girlfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary. They provided an excellent, comfortable table in good location. We ordered wine and the meatball app to start. That meatball appetizer...I want that everyday. For real. 

Entrees we had the Ripatelli with the boar bolognese and the day boat scallops entree. The Ripatelli is a cool concept, I believe it's lasagna sheets ripped up in the Chef's own personal take on a new pasta form. What makes this dish isn't just the pasta, the bolognese is rich with multiple layers of flavors with each bite; it's not just the same taste over and over. +1 for the Boar. 

The scallops, perfectly cooked, wasn't a huge fan of the mascarpone polenta, but didnt dislike it - it did go well with the scallop as to not take the focus away from those round plump, crispy topped beauties. 

Good stuff - one of my favorite places in Vegas (Strip Steak being the other). 

YUM!
Gnocchi and lasagna was awesome!  Drinks are pricey and food prices are what to expect for a $$$.  $8 for domestics is a little crazy

Portofino is a decent Italian restaurant, but nothing really stands out. The gnocchi I got didn't really have thick sauce, and though the gnocchi was soft, it didn't have a ton of flavor.

I heard that the lamb is the way to go here, so maybe I'll go with that next time.

Yikes - this place is horrid.  I booked it for dinner before LOVE at the Mirage based on the reviews here and was very disappointed.  I wasn't too familiar with the Mirage restos from previous trips so I kind of went in blind.

The website says that it was voted "Best Italian Restaurant" by the Las Vegas Concierge Association.  Onda is supposed to offer classic-rustic Italian cuisine with American innovations.

What we found it offered was cafeteria quality Italian food with crappy service.

It's incredibly loud and hard to hear considering the look of the place, but it was probably made worst by this woman with a super screechy voice who was having a b-day dinner that night.

The restaurant was packed but we were seated quickly at the back in a room with a softer, romantic type decor.  It took forever to get the menus, and forever to get pretty much anything else in this place from the food to the bill.  Needless to say, we had to skip dessert to make it to LOVE on time.

I had the leek soup to start and my husband had the Ceasar salad.  Both were okay... nothing amazing.  We were both craving nice Italian pasta so he ordered the lasagna and I had the sweet pea ravioli.  Mine was pretty gross, with the pea filling done in such a way that it clumps in your mouth in a nasty way and leaves this horrid after-taste.

The lasagna was okay, but really reminded us of cafeteria type lasagna that you get at work or at school... neither of these pastas were worth the $25ish that they wanted.

Trust me, Onda is definitely skippable.  I don't know if we were here on a bad night, but this is the worst meal I've had in Vegas.
