Because it was an expensive meal, our group of 6 expected a finer dining experience.  The osso buco was very good.  The shrimp scampi with pasta lacked flavor.  Lasagna, lobster and chicken picante were all right but not fantastic.  Great service and atmosphere.  Wish the food had been better.

I like when the service is great from start to finish... This place was super impressive in the beginning but not so great towards the end. The food was very good and I have no complaints at all. The burrata agnolotti is to die for!!! So delicious, creamy, the pasta is just chewy enough, and the corn sauce was so flavorful. The chicken was pretty good but a little dry for my taste. After we got our food we did not get any attention for probably close to half an hour... Prior to this, all the staff was attentive, friendly, engaging, and offered great suggestions. Maybe as it got busier the service went downhill a bit. Don't know if we would be back but it's definitely worth trying!

This is a really nice place. The interior looks great and  the Portofino is on the edge to be a top restaurant. Nevertheless, it's not there (yet). First of all, the ladies allocating your table at the entrance who are supposed to give you the first impression of the restaurant failed at their job. They where not only unfriendly and snotty but also seemed to be bored or not happy with what they are doing. The waiter seemed very willing, was friendly and helped with our choice. However, after the food was served, no more wine was poured in our glasses and we had to help ourselves. At a restaurant at this price category, you should be able to expect a seamless service, this was not the case. Also, we were placed at a lonely corner of the restaurant where the a/c was way too cold so we had to freeze during the dinner. Besides these critics, the food was really great. Especially the signature dishes of the restaurant are recommendable.

For authentic, well-rounded and a great experience  for Italian food, Portofino would have to be the best one, thus far and I have tried a handful of Italian restaurants off and on the strip! When I walked in, I was greeted by a very nice hostess who was able to sit me and my party very quickly. There was no problem with the reservations and we had a great table! The ambiance of the restaurant is very elegant. The roof is decorated with chandeliers and gave off a very intimate vibe.

My party and I were greeted immediately by the wait staff and was prepared with the wine menu. They have an array of wine bottles and it was hard to pick one! For my meal, I had a bottle of St. Clement Vintage Oroppas 2009. (You can never go wrong with a nice bottle of cabernet!)

MEAL:
Our server was amazing! I forgot his name, but he was very welcoming. He recommended my party and I to do the chef's tasting menu. I wanted to try a lot of things so I thought this was the best for our bucks!

Complimentary herb infused bread; wow, they only give you the bread and nothing else because it is already infused with flavor! You can taste the olive oil and the herbs they used to make the bread. It complimented well with the wine while we were waiting for our food.

Appetizers:
Crab Cake Arancini; this would have to be my favorite appetizer!
Kobe Beef Meatballs w/ Squash Blossoms; the kobe beef is so tender and the squash blossoms was very light and did not overpower one another.

I had the opportunity to meet Chef Michael LaPlaca and explained the appetizers himself! He is a very humble guy who I can tell has great passion for cooking!

Pastas:
Truffle Tagliolini; This pasta dish is very delicate to taste! It is definitely simplicity at its finest!
Burrata Agnolotti w/ Lobster Crema; My favorite pasta dish! It was lobster ravioli packed with flavor and you can taste the lobster with every bite!
Spaghetti Carbonara; the spaghetti was the least of my favorite, but still good to try.

Entrees:
Veal Osso Buco w/ saffron risotto; The meat just melts off the bone and when you eat it, it'll leave you speechless. It is my favorite dish and I crave it. The veal is cooked perfectly and the saffron risotto complimented the roundness of the meat's flavor with the delicate flavor of the saffron risotto. You are also given a fork to scoop out the bone marrow. It had that beefy, buttery taste that melts in your mouth. This is definitely a MUST TRY!

Chicken Rollatini Parmesan: The chicken is cooked to perfection! Once I cut into it, the meat was moist and the melted mozzarella with the house made marinara was amazing.

Dessert:
Deconstruced Canoli: I love canoli. Period.
Nutella Cream Macaron: Who doesn't love nutella? It was heavenly.

My overall experience at Portofino was truly memorable. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves authentic, old-fashioned Italian food. Every dish I had was exquisite and unique to its own taste. The service was amazing. Truly a 5 STAR experience. My water glass and my wine glass was never empty, my plate was always replaced to clean ones and the server was very personable! He made my dinner very pleasant and made sure that I was having a great experience. I cannot wait to dine here again!

I should really start by saying homemade pasta does not always equal creative, delicate, delicious, opulent, and amazing....but in this case it did. I love this restaurant, the staff, each dish, the desserts, the chef, and the manager. I will fly to Las Vegas just to eat at Portofino and go back home. Each pasta was delicate and balanced and a work of art.

Oh my, where to begin this review.... Many yelpers gave this restaurant 4 stars and this time my yelper friends definitely let me down.  This was our first restaurant stop in Vegas on a 4 day birthday trip.  We wanted to dine at a restaurant that was in the same casino as the Beatles LOVE by Cirque de Soleil. as we had 9:30 show tickets.  We arrived at 7:30 and were greeted by a friendly hostess.  We were led in through a weird and completely empty bar with a lonely bartender watching TV.  Then we walked into what seemed like a very nice dining room and seated at a large booth.  Our waiter was swift and very pleasant.  Service throughout the entire meal was spectacular, hence the 2 stars as opposed to 1 star for this dining experience.
The food was so strange.  I ordered the fish prepared in parchment pouch.  What was supposed to be basically a fish in a nice broth came as a overcooked piece of fish in a god awful very heavy marinara sauce.  This entrée was just gross.  However my waiter was very polite about it and immediately helped me order another fish entrée, which when it came, was very tasty.  Hubby ordered the veal osso bucco which came so overcooked and rubbery, it was ridiculous.  His comment was that it seemed they had re-heated it in the microwave. The dining room ambience is very quiet and romantic.  The service is excellent.  In my opinion these are the only two reasons this dining room is still open.  There are so many other excellent choices, my advice is to skip this one.

Awful!  My  husband and I went to Onda to celebrate out 10th wedding anniversary.  We started with the fried calamari.  It was not crisp at all- very chewy.  It was served with a pink sauce.  I asked the waiter if it was supposed to be marinara sauce and he said of course it is very nasty.  He said it gets pink because the chef purees it.  I never heard of such a thing.  The caesar salad was very good.  For my entree I had the shrimp scampi linguine.  It was ok.  You could tell that the pasta wasn't cooked fresh.  My husband had the chicken parm.  It had a very nice flavor only the chicken breast was overly processed like rubber.  The waiter never once came by during dinner to ask how everything was.  We definitely got an attitude because we didn't order wine.  We are Vegas regulars and good Italian food is a tough find.  Stay away from Onda.  It was good years ago when Todd English owned it.
Service was very attentive. The  Caesar  salad and Alaskan  wild caught  king salmon  was delicious. Well worth the visit.

This place is great!  On Friday nights they offer a free wine tasting.  We were there during the Sauvignon Blanc tastings and all 4 wines were pretty good.  The wine and cheese list were good, the service was friendly and atmosphere was very relaxing.  Definitely recommend this place if you are in the Mirage.

Excellent!!! This place is a hidden gem tucked behind the slot machines in the Mirage. The restaurant is very intimate and extremely tastefully decorated. The table had a half booth which was elegant and comfortable.   Service was excellent from start to finish with one of the owners telling me about the highlights of the menu. Our main waiter Sam was excellent and very attentive. The wine list was great with many different offerings and all price points. The mark up on the bottles were about 3X of face value. The only area of weakness on the wine list was the port dessert wine they only had one wine which was underwhelming. 

The food was excellent. I started with the Cesar salad and it was the best I have had in Las Vegas the dressing was heavy but it tasted light.  For my main course I had the gnocchi with lamb. The gnocchi was made in house and was perfectly cooked. The sauce was very complex and full of flavor. My wife is gluten free and she had the lobster noodle and she said this was the best gluten free noodles she has ever had. We were told that all their noodles even their gluten free was made in house.  This is rare to find at a restaurant. I ended my meal with tiramisu. It was very good. My wife had the Nutella cream brûlée. I wish I ordered that. It wasn't too sweet but just right amount of Nutella flavor. The cream brûlée was silky smooth with a nice made to order caramelization on top. 

This was an excellent meal and I look forward to coming back and trying different items on the menu

I had dinner here last evening after a wonderful performance of Beatles Love. We started out with cocktails at the bar with bartender Raul.  Raul was the kind of bartender who keeps millions coming back to Vegas every year--friendly, professional, and charming.  When we were ready to be seated, Raul went to the hostess stand to let them know.   He even checked in with us as we were finishing our dinner to see how we liked it, and spoke to us by name.  Little things like that separate the amateurs from the professionals, and make guests feel appreciated.  Our server for dinner, Joe, was no different.  Perhaps we were fortunate that we were dining late, and since they weren't very busy they could give us particular attention?  Whatever the reason, our experience was literally flawless.  The service, drink, wine, and food were fantastic.

Great service, Onda! We were running late for "Love" and decided to sit at the bar with only 45-minutes to eat. We ordered a few small but really satisfying appetizers and two glasses of wine. In contrast with the Mirage lobby, Onda offered a calm and quiet place to enjoy our food. Service was excellent! They got us in and and out and offered great suggestions.

We went here for a small meal before getting on a plane later that night. We sat at the bar and had a great time. My boyfriend and I each got a wine flight. This was excellent! The bartender was fabulous, hand picked all the wines, and explained them while pointing out the flavor notes and how they complimented the food. We got a couple of appetizers all of which were good. The only downside was the calamari - it was definitely sub-par. We had these steak tartare crostinis which were amazing! I definitely want to come back and enjoy a full meal here.

I am staying at Mirage and we wanted to eat dinner for my brothers birthday. We were originally debating between Portofino and Japonis and I'm so happy we chose Portofino. Great service and amazing food. But, one thing you should know is if you want your food to arrive immediately that's a no no. It takes a while for your entrees to arrive.

We started with 2 appetizers; Caprese Salad, which had fresh red tomatoes and was very refreshing. The second appetizer was the Octopus Salad, it was kind of dry for my taste but when I ate it with bread it tasted a lot better. 

Angoloti whatever (it has an Italian name I can't spell) the lobster was excellent and cooked very well. I really suggest you get this when you go because it is really worth the price!!

Great service! Chris is awesome and very helpful! Food was great as well! I'll definitely come back. Ask for the first booth! It's everyone's favorite apparently like Anthony Hopkins, Tim Allen, and Ron White!

We wanted a semi quick bite to eat after a long day working a trade show. Enter, Portofino. We walked right in and were seated at the bar. Score! The gentleman who served us was adorable and an absolute gem. 

My coworker and I ended up having the meatballs, crab cakes and chicken-foie-fredo - all absolutely DIVINE.

Some friends and I had 9:30pm tickets to see Beatles LOVE and wanted to have a nice dinner beforehand. We settled on Portofino - close to the show, we all agreed on Italian, reasonable prices, and I saw burrata on the menu and thought YES, PLEASE! I firmly believe burrata and/or a fried egg makes every meal better.

This place is a lot bigger on the inside than it looks, from the outside it's situated in this little corner of The Mirage and it's kind of hidden. Interior is really nice and cozy, lighting is on point. Service was very good - the manager, waiter, and the busser were all very attentive,  knowledgable, and ready to help. 

The olive oil soaked focaccia they bring to your table is divine and I could've eaten several baskets of it! I ordered the Caesar Salad and Burrata Agnolotti. The salad presentation was great, they do a cool spin on the crouton, and as a self-proclaimed Caesar salad expert, the salad was perfect! The burrata agnolotti was, well, delicious. Burrata + pasta + lobster = something I could eat every day for the rest of my life and be very satisfied. Portions are pretty generous but not so overwhelming you'll be uncomfortably stuffed. I tried my friend's gnocchi and it was literally melt in your mouth. It was the best gnocchi I've ever had, and the agnolotti was up there as well in terms of pasta. Another friend got the Ripatelli and she finished the whole dish. To some that might not mean a lot, but she is not someone who normally finishes dishes, so that means a lot for her to eat a big plate of it! 

Prices here are reasonable, especially for Vegas. I paid about $20 for a couple tiny tacos, a side of chips, and a free cup of water the day before for lunch, so $30-$40 for some pasta that is miles ahead with quality seems pretty good!

Are you craving for inexpensive rustic Italian dinner?  Look elsewhere.

Upon entering, we went through the white wood panneled wine lounge stocked with myriad of vinos behind clear glass cabinetry...I want this room in my house.  "Uh-huh..."  my hubby responded.  He's adding to his mental list of my "I wants".  Not that I will ever see any of it come to fruition.

Our server had our reserved table for 16 at 5pm all ready as we were seated.  I mentioned this because often times, even with a prearranged reservation, there would be silverware, glassware and/or plates missing from the setting.  Which annoys me to no end.

We ordered some appetizers to be shared which includes:  caprese ($14) calamari fritti ($16), beef carpaccio with black truffle oil ($14),  antipasti and cheese plate ($19).  I was not too fond of the calamari's rubbery texture and hard breading.  The beef carpaccio could use a little more truffle oil.  The rest was pretty good.  The bread and butter looked uhmazing, but I was a good girl that night and left it alone...I do have some will power!  Okay, I didn't want to bloat in my cute sexy dress and cut the circulation in my high heels!  (you girls know what I'm talking about)

The girls and I split a recommended couple of bottle of red wine ($50 ea).  Most in our party wanted sweeter varietals, which the place had none.  I prefer dry reds with my meals, so we decided to order individual drinks after we finished the bottles.   The guys had their favorite liquor on the rocks ($12).   

For the entree, I had the Roasted Branzini ($40) over fingerling potatoes with lemon and capers.  It reminded me of orange roughy.  My first choice was the Garlic Crusted Sea Bass  ($38) on top of spinach and tomatoe oil, but almost everyone ordered that.  The special that day was the Rib Eye ($55) which a couple of people ordered.  Good gosh, I hope they enjoyed that one enough for the price.  Hubby, for some reason, ordered the Lasagna ($28).  I tried to get him to order a specialty, but he said that was one of them...oh well.  Lobster Milanese ($55) my sister let me taste off her plate was so good!  Now, that was worth the price.  Both my nieces ordered each a Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli ($49) they raved about.  My little cutie pie had half serving of the Fettuccine Alfredo ($11), nephew and niece had the Capellini Pomodoro ($11).  My Mother Dearest, who was the star of this trip enjoyed her Veal Piccatta $36), but not with her usual saying "Well, when I had this in Italy..." my sisters and I all roll our eyes with love.

We also ordered a tiramisu birthday cake ($50) with candles and all...of course we didn't want to use up all their candles.  Can't pass up the coffee! 

I could not have asked for a better service and we were not rushed at all.  In fact, they took their time making sure everything was just right.  It was truly an amazing night...until I got the check.  I fainted and they had to air evac me outta there.  Okay, I'm being melodramatic here.  My sis and I shared the bill and the rest of my gambling money was thrown in there.  

Memories...priceless!

Definitely overpriced. Super expensive vegetarian meal that was so-so. Eggplant stuffed with way too much cheese and watery spaghetti next to it.  Service was good.

You must pay for the really cool atmosphere/decorating...

This place is outstanding.  Everything was superb, and the lobster pasta dish is worth coming to Vegas just to have it.  Service was excellent as well.  The GM Chris spent some time at our table, and it is clear he is the driving force in the service and menu quality.  This will be one of our go-to restaurants in Vegas from now on.  Must visit.

Must try - My fiance and I came back with my parents and once again everything is fantastic.  This time we sat in the actual restaurant area.  Love love love their lasagna.  We also tried something new, the antipasta for an app, and it fed all 4 of us, plus had extras.  

While waiting for our food, they brought us fresh bread with the oil and parmesan (yummmmm). SO fresh and soft that we went through 2 baskets.  

Also, a photographer came and took a mini engagement session of pics with me us which came out pretty cute.  

I think we will come to Onda every time we're in Vegas.

My husband and I tried to recreate our first date at this place. It used to be called "Onda" when we met.
Even though the restaurant is now called Portofino, the service was absolutely amazing and the general manager Chris Zadie was very accommodating to our needs. He made our night extra special with the superb and impeccable service. 
It's nice to feel like you are valuable as a customer. I am extremely appreciative when people go the extra mile to make your celebration perfect even thought it really doesn't mean anything to them. 
We want to be back soon. Thank you for giving us the perfect dinner date.

My husband I were in Las Vegas and a friend of ours recommended that we try this Italian restaurant. We love Italian food and was told that we must try this place. And we were glad we did! 

It had the best Italian pasta we have ever had. The gnocchi was soft like pillows and amazingly tasty. The meatballs were incredibly moist. All the pasta, bread and sauces were made in the restaurant. My favorite pasta was the lobster ravioli. My husband loved the veal osso buco. 

The service was excellent. Rocco was our server and he was very friendly and attentive. The Manager Chris, was very professional, courteous and knowledgeable. We had a very pleasant experience and will highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Italian food. 

To be fair, some of the pasta were a tad salty for me but the taste was excellent. If you don't like too much salt, I would request that upfront. Maybe it was just me because I don't like too much salt in my meals. But this is truly an excellent Italian restaurant. We will go back whenever we are in Las Vegas. Excellent!!! A must try.
Great atmosphere and food! Service was pretty good too. The selection is interesting but I love trying new things. Love the ambiance. Will go back!

Four for dinner before a show. Basically everything was good, pasta with lobster was shared by 2 of us as an appetizer and as an entree by the other two in our party, excellent, other dishes were all very good and very good service. Nothing exceptional and nothing below par, there is better and certainly many not as good. Worth a try.

Very good service and food.  The ambience is excellent.  The prices are reasonable as well.  I had the Rigatoni Bologonese.  The meat sauce is amazing.  I am still dreaming about it.  Rigatoni is a definite must!!!

I had to update my review to 5 starts, because I have been eating Bolognese every week in NY lately, and nothing compares to Onda's bolognese.....

Dining as it should be!  I have been coming to last Vegas since 1997 and have eaten at all the  "top chef" restaurants, you know the Tom Colicchio, Emeril Lagasse and Mario Batali joints. PORTOFINO blew all of these restaurants out of the water, in 2 areas:  service and food quality.  Our party of 4 had the most attentive, charming and respectful servers, hostesses and even the bartenders were pleasant; as I was walking to the restroom they greeted me and inquired how I was enjoying my dinner so far. The manager Chris Zadie was AMAZING, he chatted with our table throughout our dinner, he taught us the history behind some of the plates, he brought our food out and even ordered special food items for our table to enjoy (free of cost) because he overheard us talking about how much we enjoyed stuffed zucchini blossoms. We really felt special and pampered by the wait staff and having the manager be so attentive makes you feel like a V-I-P. Side note: my party of 4 was myself, my sister and parents, so we weren't a table of hot young 20 somethings, thus the attention from the manager and wait staff was very genuine. The passion emanating from the manager, Chris, was very refreshing, he made dinner not just about food but a true culinary art experience. 

The food quality was insanely good- the portions were surprisingly large, you will not leave here hungry. We ordered the meatballs (the goat-cheese stuffed squash blossoms are to die for) the manager informed us about the origins of the cheese and how it came from near Mt. Vesuvius), braised oxtail lasagna (melt in your mouth softness), the lobster (which was on a platter- it was so huge), the wild boar bolognese Ripatelli and the tiramisu. We also had some amazing cocktails, our waiter and manager helped us find the right one that fitted our taste for the evening and they did not steer us wrong.  

Service was fast, the ambiance was lovely. The restaurant appeared small and cozy, yet seated a lot of people. I would love to book out their private dining section for an engagement party.  Needless to say this will be on our list of top restaurants in Las Vegas, really looking forward to going back next time I return.

I love this place, perfect date night dinner.  We ordered crab cake, calamari ,Burrata Agnolotti, steak and creme bruelee. Ig
Everything is just perfect.  KIM our server is really good and efficient. "25 years ago he opened the Mirage"

I received VIP treatment at this fine restaurant yesterday.  I sat at the bar and ordered the burrata agnolotti. It took a long time to come out. Scott was my server and he apologized for the wait and had the manager Chris Zadie come talk to me. Chris also apologized and explained to me that the chef was making the pasta from scratch. The chef personally delivered my pasta to me and also apologized for the wait. Wow it was worth the wait. The pasta was heavenly. Probably one of the best meals I have ever had. The lobster was tender and the sauce was decadent. They also brought out tiramisu and comped all of my meal including wine. I cannot say enough good things about the food and service here. I will be back to Portofino's next time I am in Vegas. But I will make reservations as it seems tables are hard to get here.

Avoid!  Perhaps some of the laziest cooking I've ever experienced. I believe salt to be the lazy cook's solution to putting in effort and skill--and Onda is among the saltiest foods I've ever eaten. At nearly $300 for a party of 4 I'd say in a city full of culinary options as Vegas, your money is most definitely better spent elsewhere. 

Nice looking place (far better than the rest of the dumpy, old Mirage) but I can't eat marble floors and counters and with very little effort there's better to be had. 

Spoiled mussels.  Gritty lobster pasta. Over-salted food.  Half-attentive wait staff.

After reading all of the other yelpers reviews, we ventured in, on a Saturday night at about 6:30.  we were promptly seated at our reserved table (they sat us at a square table which quickly got over crowded-- request a round one if at all possible) 3 of the menu's that were brought to the table had something on them- 2 were sticky. 1 was covered in what was probably table salt  (no biggie right)  just a heads up- the service was SLOW-- but the FOOD made up for that 10 fold.  

The waiter brought bread sticks (think giant crackers) to the table and set part of them on my salt covered menu (note to self DON'T eat that part) A few minutes later the bread basket appears with a strange yellow substance on a plate. (no one from the wait-staff drops by to tell us what it is-- so we dared someone in our group to try it,, 3 against 1) it turned out to be a corn spread- similar in consistency to polenta. 

we ordered caesar salads- they were nicely done, with a Parmesan crisp on top & just the right size to leave room for the amazing dinner to follow.  

For dinner, I had the Ricotta, potato Gnocchi- it came with roasted chicken and a wonderful cream sauce that cannot be described any other way except PERFECT. 
The rest of the table's meals we're equally superb.    the Osso Bucco was apparently in the top 5 of the best my sis in law had Ever had.  the hubby got the lasagna, it had veal & pork and was very flavorful without being too salty. My brother had the Lobster Risotto and he was just as impressed with his meal as we all were with ours.  

Dessert was good, but I've had better of both the creme brulee & the tieramissu 

I should note:  
Be CAREFUL when choosing wine from their massive wine list, as they are organized by country & color, BUT not by price, they have $26 bottles right next to $3000 bottles.. a mix up could be costly.

All in all the meal was fantastic.. were there a few things id change? yes.. like the weird bread stick thing.. and not knowing what the corn dish was. but is that going to stop me from eating there again?  Hell No. I cant wait to go back!

4|24\08 Returned to Onda as part of the dinner package for LOVE and had a very different experience than last time.

Menu extremely limited 3 items I believe and at $50 each not a good value when you can do a la carte for about he same price

And then there was the food: Caesar's salad, Minestrone, Veal Marsala, crusted Sea Bass with veggie and 2 small chocolate mousse(only dessert offered)
Service was slow and we were ignored essentially

This was a forgettable experience...see the show LOVE...skip the dinner package at Onda at least

Agree with Kristin S the tomato olive garlic in olive oil served with a Variety of Italian breads was a great start
Caprese  salad and Blue cheese with apple/on Romaine  were fresh and tasty
Ossa Buco on a bed of Risotto was soooo....good
Sweet pea ravioli with melted butter and balsamic vinegar was enjoyed at the table and later in our room
Dessert we split a  creme brule that was a solid finish to very good meal...there were no disappointments

Just took my wife to Portofino for her birthday last night, before seeing the LOVE show. The restaurant was not very crowded, which was a welcome relief from the crowds on the casino floor. The decor and ambiance were very elegant. The staff was very nice and attentive. The food was amazing. Just tasting the bread, I knew that we were in for a real treat. We started with the caprese salad, my wife had the linguini with clams and I had the chicken parmesan. Chicken parmesan is my favorite Italian dish, and I've ordered it at several restaurants. But this dish was 10x better than any I've had before. And the portion size was surprisingly large, but I had no problem finishing it. My wife absolutely loved her meal, as well.  This was a very nice change of pace for us. We probably would have eaten at a typical Vegas buffet, but I wanted to take my wife someplace special for her birthday. And Portofino filled the bill on all counts. We definitely hope to return.
Like 2 weeks ago my BF and I we came for dinner the food is great and the services is it's a little pricy but it's worth it I really recommend this restaurant I would totally go again thank you
Elegant ambiance set the meal of braised veal on saffron rice...magnificent! Can't wait to come back! Kim was our hospitable  waiter who has worked there since it opened 30 years ago.

Maybe I should have read the menu a little bit closer... But what ended up on my plate shocked me and continues to shock me. 

Popcorn on salmon... Popcorn on salmon... POPCORN ON SALMON! 

I've had some strange combinations of food but nothing like this. I was open minded about the dish but then I had a popcorn kernel stuck in one of my tooth and I had to pluck the rest off of my dish. Plus  the garnish was too much. I believe it was a potato purée with grilled corn, roasted bell peppers, and roasted mushrooms. A bit too much for a fine dining restaurant. 

However, great Caesar salad, even tastier soup, and lasagna is delicious! 

JUST DONT ORDER THE SALMON.

Fan-freakin-tastic!  We dined on 9/9/17 and Rocco was our waiter with Chris coming around quite frequently to see how we were fairing and to pour us our first bubbles of the evening.  Service was spot on!  We had the "crab cake" arancini for an app--delish and perfect size to share as it was quite rich.  I had the lobster anglotti and BF had the veal parm--it was giant and the pasta marinara that came on the side was amazing, so simple, but amazing.  In fact, I woke up Sunday morning and said "I wish we had the rest of that pasta in the fridge!"  Only ding, which is not their fault was the cappuccino machine was on the fritz, but we did get a coffee with a shot of espresso--thank goodness because we had been up since 3:45am to get to LAS!  A wonderful dining experience for sure, and I would love to come back! Grazie!

Everything was amazing.

We started with a glass of chianti wine and of course they brought out some delicious herb infused bread. 
We ordered the chicken Parmesan, which was good but has Italian sausage in the middle, the sauce was fabulous. We also ordered the gnocchi... I was speechless. Spinach gnocchi with arugula and mushrooms in a delicious and light garlic and mushrooms sauce.
Since we were celebrating my moms birthday they brought out dessert, the nutelli with chocolate gelato and chocolate sauce....  
Again, everything was amazing. From the moment we walked in to the time we left. We will definitely be back!

This place totally sucks.  I had the unfortunate experience of dining at Onda while staying at the Mirage with my girlfriend.  We were utterly disappointed.  First of all, the service was slow and terrible.  But since we on vacation and not in any hurry, we were willing to overlook the service hoping the quality of the meal would compsensate.  Again, we were let down.  The pasta tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp too long and was reminiscent of something you'd expect from a hospital cafeteria.  Perhaps, I'm a little spoiled from dining in Chicago, but for the prices this place charges we expected a decent meal.  The Mirage should be embarrassed to even have this place in the hotel.  Look for better options in Las Vegas and spare yourself the inevitable disappointment of dining at Onda.

I felt like having Italian last night and stopped in.  This was named "Onda" until fairly recently, when a new chef took over the reins.  I was alone and sat at the bar.  The bartender, a guy from the Philippines, waited on me.  I noted another Filipino waiter then it struck me:  if I went into a sushi bar, I don't expect Billy Bob to cook for or serve me.  One invariably sees Japanese in a sushi bar.  Was anyone in this place Italian? I noticed the same thing in another MGM property--Il Fornaio in NYNY, except they were Hispanic.

The menu was quite short.  The wine list was expansive.  I had a nice Cabernet from Napa.  I ordered the crab cake appetizer and the osso buco.  The waiter asked if I wanted them in that order.  I felt like saying "No let's start with the entree and have the appetizer afterwards".   Of course in the backwards Southeast US they bring the appetizer at the same time as the entree, so go figure.  I had the crab cake appetizer which was outstanding.  For my entree I had the osso buco, which was tender and filling.

Overall it was satisfying except for a large, loud noisy party that kept invading my space.

My wife and I just ate at Portofino at the Mirage. it was one of the best and most fun dinners we have ever had. Our server Chuck was wonderful and the general manager Chris Zadie was very helpful and knowledgeable. We will definitely be returning here in the future. It was an oasis of luxury in  a casino.

We had an excellent dinner at Portofino. Atmosphere is very nice and quiet so you can talk. Very pretty restaurant. Service was excellent and we all enjoyed our meals.  We had the caprese salad and crab cake appetizer. Mozzarella cheese was homemade and very creamy. Crab cake had really nice flavor. Two people in our party got the veal osso buco and loved it. It fell off the bone and had excellent flavor.  I had the chicken Parmesan rollatini and it was delicious. For dessert, the chocolate amaretto cake was incredible.  It was our favorite meal so far in Vegas. Everything was perfect. Servers were nice and very attentive.

My husband and I went to Onda for dinner...unfortunately it did not live up to expectations.  The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and has a great atmosphere. We had a booth tucked in a corner and there was no one next to us (we had 6 pm reservations), so it was romantic and cozy.  Our server was very nice...attentive without being pushy.  The best thing that we ate was the bread and dipping mix that other reviews have raved about...it was delicious.  If we had just stopped with that, Onda would get at least 4 stars from me...unfortunately, we had an appetizer and dinner.

For an appetizer, we had the calamari.  It ranks as some of the worst calamari we have had...the breading was overpowering and I am not sure the calamari was cooked perfectly.  I ordered the capellini and scallops...big mistake.  The pasta flavor was incredibly bland and the scallops were super rubbery and did not have a good flavor at all.  They were so poor that I could barely force myself to eat two of them.  My husband ordered the garlic crusted sea bass which he said was just OK and there was nothing special to it.  We certainly did not feel that the quality of the food lived up to the amount we paid, which is why Onda only gets 2 stars from me.

After walking around the Mirage looking for some food, this restaurant looked pleasant enough. We sat down, were choosing our meal, to discover a German COCKROACH crawling upon our menu. Is the food unclean? Bug infestation? Call me petty but I refuse to eat at a place that supply's bugs as their main course.

Second time we were invited to eat at this fabulous place. Our friend, Chris Zadie who is by far, the best customer service in the country, serves us with the utmost and respectable hospitality. Not to mention the food! Chef is extraordinaire! First time there, I wasn't dieting so I got to taste a family style menu, but the second time, I was on a diet but I was prepared a delicious, healthy Branzino that tasted amazing! We want to come here every time we are in town! Thank you for the excellent service and the most authentic Italian dishes ever!

Absolutely the worst "Italian" food I never taste. We dine Monday night, with reservation, 2 adult and our child. 
Service!!! do not exist, I saw my server twice during dinner, at the beginning when the hostess introduced him and at the end to drop the check. My wine and food order was took by the manager/sommelier "the only positive note of our experience" The food is a joke from quality, taste, flavors, presentation.

I'm a fan of Italian. I love pasta and all the carbs that follow. But after a disappointing meal at Fiamma and now a mediocre meal at Portofino I'm willing to forsake the cuisine all together. Portofino, the restaurant formerly known as Onda, at the Mirage is a beautiful and intimate space ornately decorated with faux gold accents. Comfortable and spacious booths line the walls. White linen covered tables fill the rest of the room.

Everything looked great, alluding to a great meal to follow. The food looked impressive too. It's all beautifully plated. The crab cake arancini to start the meal was a well balanced dish of savoriness with hints of acidity and sweetness. The rest of the meal was a huge letdown. The spinach gnocchi, while nicely plated, was unusually soft and doughy, lacking any sort of textural contrast. Even prettier was burrata filled agnolotti surrounded by lobster. Unfortunately, the sauce was too rich and flavors were muddled with none of the elements standing out.

It's a shame the food didn't have much substance because Portofino would be a good date spot. But average food and service make this a restaurant I wouldn't recommend unless you want to break up with someone.

Super cute!

Icredibly cozy wine lounge with 5* Appetizers, pedestrian friendly wines & relaxed atmosphere. Perfect pre- cirque show drink spot .

Overall disappointed is at the forefront of my experience. Firm believer that eating at a restaurant that has somebody who can make fresh pasta and is recognized for that would want to ensure that it shines. Ordered Cesar Salad, meatballs, chicken rollatini parmesan, calamari and the lasagna. 
We will start with service. If it were not because the Manager did tend to our table we would have been waiting for awhile. Our server did not come until we were half way through meal.  Hence the reason for the first two stars is the manager and the team for helping out. Even though after asking for recommendation and advising we were eating family style we were given dishes that ended up tasting fairly the same because the  house made sauce was used on all the dishes with the exception of the salad.  The pasta was good and cooked perfectly and that's my reason for the additional star.  All the food was acceptable and ok, but definitely not a place I would consider a pride of Vegas. If anything it's another restaurant amongst the vast amount restaurants. I would say if you are looking for ok food and are staying on the property eat here. If you are looking for a dining experience and amazing food do yourself a favor and look on! You will be happy you did as Vegas is known for the vast amount of amazing restaurants.  Dinner is about walking away with a fully tummy and a smile on your face.  Happy eating!

Went before Love and as has been noted it is very good for this. The Osso Bucco my girlfriend ordered was excellent, my rigitoni bolognese was acceptable. The feta and tomato tort we shared for a starter was very rich, and the sorbet I closed things up with was great.

I enjoyed the service. They were not up in our face, gave us plenty of space to enjoy our 2 hour meal. They did not flinch when we arrived 5 minutes late and with 2 people instead of the 4 we had originally made the reservation for. 

I'm sure there are better Italian restaurants in Vegas and I will work on tracking one down on my next visit, but this place did a great job filling me up before the show.
Very. Good.  Old school service.  Waiters were excellent.  Highly recommend it veal and fish dishes were excellent.  Had gelato for dessert. No great.  Little icy.

I came to the Mirage to see the Love show, and came to dinner here before. I got a Caesar salad and some chicken parm. The salad was excellent, and the chicken was a little hard. I think it was over done. For the price we paid it should of been perfect. The staff was great, but thought the food should of been better. I wish I was hungrier because the cheese trays looked yummy

This place is a gem!! My friend and I live in Las Vegas and are always looking to try something new or different. When you walk into Portofino you are transported to a different place. You are no longer in a casino on the Las Vegas Strip but a cozy Italian getaway with Italian marble clad floors and beautiful walls full of recipes.  
The staff and service from start to finish was phenomenal! I didn't get the hostess' name, but she greeted us with a smile and seated us immediately. Our server, Rocco, was so friendly and knowledgeable. He has been working there for over 25 years! His assistant, Brian, has a long record there as well. Both performed perfect service. Rocco shared some of the restaurant's history with us as he recommend dishes from the menu. Everything sounded so good, and being the Foodies that we are, we ordered a little of everything! We were not disappointed. Words cannot express how delicious the food at Portofino is. You MUST try it for yourself! Chris, the manager was on point as well. We let Rocco know what profile of wine we were looking for, Chris then came over and made the PERFECT recommendation that fit both of our tastes. Chris was very hospitable and made us feel like we were dining in his home. You can really tell that the staff here loves and appreciates the food and opportunity they have here to really make a guest experience! 

Order everything!!! All the pasta is homemade AND cut to order!! What!?! Yes! The homemade mozzarella was delicious and the scallops were divine. The Burrata ravioli with lobster? Amazing! 

I could go on and on, but what are you waiting for? Try it for yourself!

Great customer service! We had the meatball, crab cakes, pork shank and the homemade ravioli.  The food was great! We had the crewmen brûlée and tiramisu for dessert-- good. The appetizers and ravioli was very authentic.
Spectacular service and food. Left very content and satisfied! Our entire group enjoyed the atmosphere and environment. Next time we visit Vegas we are coming back!
My fiancé and I have eaten here twice and both times Jason was our waiter.  He has been absolutely amazing and it definitely helps that the food is amazing!

This has to be one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas. I wandered in on a Friday night as I had heard about the free wine tasting. This is great as you can sit in the lounge, sip the wine and have appetizers. We were shocked on how good the appetizers were and could have stayed all night sampling.

Went back the next evening to see if the regular food menu compared. Ended up ordering the 3-course prix fixe and even this was wonderful. The meat was cooked to perfection. And they do have a great wine list. 

What makes it even more special is that it is one of the last restaurants still owned by an hotel. Was glad to support a local restaurant instead of a chain.

You could walk by Onda - it's tucked away in a corner of the sprawling Mirage casino,  somewhere between the fantastic steakhouse Stack and a Wheel Of Fortune bank of video slots, Onda's reticence in coming out as a full blown restaurant is not unlike throwing good money after bad at the crap tables.

The food however is a jackpot, and the service at the hands of Susan, was like betting on the 0/00 at Roulette and having it come in - twice.  Our meal consisted of a cold shrimp appetizer and a Caesar Salad that was overcrowded by croutons but had a wonderfully intense dressing.

The Occo Busso arrived drizzled in a rich sauce that was really beyond description.  The baked chicken was perfectly executed on a bed of root vegetables.  What was totally off the hook was the accompanied cheese polenta.  Fantastic.  The Tira Misu was the best that I've had as well as the Cheese Cake.  Fantastic.

With all the awards that Onda has won, you'd think it would be more crowded.  Getting in on a Saturday night was a breeze, and we didn't even need our Mirage Host George's help in getting a reservation - although he did.  Great job George!

Good food, but fair ambience.  Our waiters were efficient, but lacked personality and attention to detail.  The wine selection is fair...I will try this again when fellow diners do not have their cell phones turned up to max. volume...way too much ringing and disturbance for an enjoyable dining experience.

We enjoyed the Italian food at this restaurant.. the service was prompt, and they had a few vegetarian options (although the primavera they made for us off the menu was the best item served!)


The eggplant was kinda crappy.. the sweet pea ravioli was good, although it was undercooked and looked like fying saucers to me.  

The bread was great...and the sticks were amazing..

We did not do dessert here.

Overpriced, very mediocre Italian. Given the choices in town I would avoid this place. Not to mention the Mirage had a sick nauseating smell of cigarette smoke they tried to cover with a sweet smelling deodorant. It permeates the whole casino. I would vastly prefer the smell of cigarette smoke alone.

My wife picked this spot as the place to have her birthday dinner. It ended up being a great choice. We made reservations and were seated immediately upon arrival. I ordered a bottle of wine that is one of our favorites (Justin - Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles). We enjoyed the olive oil soaked bread that was served to hold us over until the entree came. My wife and I got the lasagna. It was insane. It was made with Oxtail Ragu and I cannot wait to have it again. The oxtail was such a fine touch to this meal. They also brought a delicious Tiramisu for us to sing "Happy Birthday" . I look forward to eating here again someday. And I will absolutely order that lasagna again.

What a wonderful place!  Celebrated our wedding night with my son and his girlfriend.  We got married on the wedding gondola at the Venetian, good fun!   Then dinner at Portofino's and the show Love.

When we arrived for dinner, we were greeted by management.  We were congratulated for the wedding, then presented with a wonderful bottle of champagne.  Sorry, can't remember, but an excellent bottle.  

For dinner we shared some calamari and mussels.  Some eggplant with fresh tomatoes, etc..  A wonderful start, along with a delish Caesar salad with anchovies.  

The entrees were a mix from sea bad to breaded veal with fresh arugula and tomatoes tossed in a light dressing.  The grilled octopus was the most memorable dishes of the night.  All and all, a great evening with wonderful service. We will go back for one of our anniversaries, as it was a special night to remember.

We made reservations for Onda because of its convenience near the Terry Fator theatre. While we're local Las Vegas residents, we'd never dined at the restaurant. When we arrived, we weren't sure what to expect as the bar dining entry area is rather brightly illuminated and without the Italian upscale decor we were expecting for a romantic dinner. After a brief walk through the bar area, we turned the corner into what seemed like a different restaurant. The decor, ambiance, lighting, configuration and atmosphere was exactly what we were hoping for. (Candidly, the chairs are so comfortable we both expressed how in the future we'll linger for an extra hour enjoying after dinner drinks and desert.)

The wine list offers an extensive selection of Italian vino and the General Manager (Chris Zadie) offered wonderful insights and selections based on our preferences. We really enjoyed the quantity of 375ml bottles offered on the list and ordered two. 

The pasta dishes are all home made and our two selections were 5*. In addition, that night (Jan 4), they had Italian White Truffle and we enjoyed the 5 oz shaving. 

We didn't have time for desert because of the show; however, we both really enjoyed the dining experience and look forward to returning. 

I recommend Onda and anticipate I'll be hosting family and business events here. It's conveniently located near the Terry Fator theatre and great restaurant for a couple seeking a pre-show romantic Italian dining experience.

I had the most UNREAL dish here. It was gnocchi with mushrooms and arugula, if i remember correctly. It was MOUTH WATERING. I would have licked my plate if it wouldn't have been frowned upon. Aside from an amazing meal, our water glasses were never empty and the food came out within a decent time of ordering it. My family members and friend also claim that their dishes were to die for. I would definitely recommend this place if you're a lover of Italian food!!!
Horrible! Their signature dish "chicken parm" tasted like it was frozen and reheated. The sauce was disgusting.

Sat at the bar and was serviced by ultra outgoing bartender Raul. He was very close, but did not quite cross over the line of being too buggy. He was very knowledgeable about the changes the restaurant had/was going through as well as their menu. 

Their gnocchi was excellent, and the veal saltimbocca was average. Raul did offer advice to go with the veal osso buco when ordering instead of saltimbocca, but did not listen to him because was looking for the bacon/au jus taste. 

Overall this is a great dining choice at the Mirage.

Five of us had dinner recently at the newly renamed Portofino by Michael LaPlaca to Portofino Ristorante.  We asked the chef to come up with a tasting for us and the following items were served:

House made focaccia
Beet salad
Caprese salad
Grilled Octopus
Crab cakes arancini
Meatballs
Burrata agnolotti
Pot roast raviolini
Chicken-foie-fredo
Pumpkin spice gnocchi
Ripatelli with wild boar Bolognese
Day boat scallops
Rack of lamb
Veal osso bucco
The $65 Veal parmesan for $55
Tiramisu
Chocloate cake
Nutella crème brûlée
Sorbet with fresh fruit
Gelato--Chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry cheesecake

This was my third time eating at Portofino and Chef LaPlaca has maintained the high standards and creativity that make Portofino the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  There wasn't a dish listed above that was less than outstanding.  The creativity is evident in the dish chicken-foie-fredo.  It's hand cut fettuccini with herb roasted chicken, chicken cracklins, and foie gras Alfredo.  What a wonderful combination of flavors and textures.  The rack of lamb was superb!

I could continue but you get the idea.  There are a whole number of dishes to choose from each with great flavors.  Portofino is a gem!

The gnocchi was the best thing Ive ever tasted. (Seriously) the mushrooms played off the texture of he dumpling...so melt in your mouth wonderful...I wanted to run back in the kitchen and kiss the chef.#metoo  The chicken parmesan was better than the gnocchi, if that's even possible.  The chicken parm was sort of cordon blue style, stuffed  with herbs and cheese and all of the tasty things. Our 2011 itailan wine was perfect with our scallops which were delightful.  We moved our table because kids were screaming and it was our anniversary,  we wanted a more intimate experience.  Our service was great, multiple people touched our table but left us alone.  We even started a campaign for Michelle Obama to run for president against Trump!  Beautiful flowers. Going to have to add this to our Vegas rotation of amazing dinner spots.

What a lovely dinner! We arrived a little before our 5:15 reservation and we're seated within minutes. Yes, our waiter was a little slow to great us and take our orders, but the restaurant had just opened and many tables were being seated, so the delay was justified. 

We ordered a nice bottle of Chianti and the caprese appetizer. The bufala cheese was so fresh and amazing. For the main courses, our table ordered the chicken rollatini parmesan, the burrata agnolotti, and the lobster Milanese. The lobster dish was the special and it really stole the show (see photo). My dad also ordered the half order of the dayboat scallops. He wasn't terribly hungry and it was nice of the waiter to offer a half portion.

The decor sort of reminded me of a cruise ship dining room (with the low ceilings and the booths), but I liked it! Overall, we really enjoyed the experience and would definitely return on our next trip to Vegas!
Simply incredible meal. Best italian hands down in Vegas. This is a must see! Lobster milanese...veal shank..all awesome!

After a show at The Mirage we decided to try Portofino, and so glad we did!!  We shared the meatball appetizer which was amazing.... And I am not a meatball fan! My husband had the chicken parm, very different, had an interesting stuffing inside, beautifully presented. I had the salmon which was excellent!! The food took a bit long to get to us and the waiter apologized and said the chef wanted to buy us two glasses of wine. We didn't feel like drinking more so thanked him, but said not necessary. When we got the bill they took 20% off instead. Classy move!!

I have to say this is my second review of Portofino,  I deleted the first. On my first visit here I was not impressed, but given a second chance has changed our minds. Thanks to Chelsea, we enjoyed a wonderful dinner last week, I'm glad we were able to make it. The service was impeccable, Chris and Rocco went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. The food was excellent. It was nice to hear that we were able to mix up entrees, half of this and half of that, even try an entree as an appetizer, who knew. We chose the lobster ravioli as a side instead of an entree, just to give it a try, and were amazed. Definitely will have that as an entree next time! Which I believe will be in June, we plan to visit this place again! Thanks again for a great meal.

Very disappointing. Caesar salad had two potato crisps instead of croutons and they tasted like two Ruffles potato chips. They also were generous and included one pepperoni in my salad.  Literrally one slice of pepperoni.  Veal scallopini was over cooked, dry, bland, difficult to cut and rubbery. Marsala sauce and mushroom and asparagus were good but pretty hard to screw up mushrooms and asparagus in wine sauce.  Waiter was very gracious and brought me a Chilean sea bass crusted with potato and olive oil. It made the exterior of fish taste very dry. Once I was able to break through that crust the fish om the inside was delicious. Flaky, tender and seasoned perfectly. The fingerling potatoes were ok.  Being a chocoholic i was hoping the Flourless chocolate cake Would redeem them. It did not.

Oh my! Let's start by sharing that EVERYONE we would ask about dinner plans would say "you can't go wrong at Portofino" and man was this an understatement! 

Location and ambiance- beautiful! Elegant yet new.

Food- I can't find words to describe the pasta here. My husband loves pasta and we have visited our share or "authentic" or high end places and not one compared to the food at this place. My gnocchi was like none other I've ever had. 

Service- here is were we lost it! Upon arrival the waiter came to introduce himself. He was lovely! Then, out of nowhere Chris (who I believe to be a manager) shows up and offers assistance. My husband insisted he wanted Alfredo sauce with his meal to replace the unique sauce the dish came with. Chris then brought him a sample of the pasta with the recommended house sauce to try. I'm so glad he went beyond his way and my husband was able to try what he called "the most amazing sauce ever". Needless to say, Alfredo sauce was not needed.

You literally CAN NOT go wrong at Portofino.

Amazing service and delicious food! You definitely can't go wrong here. The Gnocchi with a sun dried tomato/garlic/cream sauce was ahhhh-freaking-mazing! The calamari was also tasty , although I didn't care for the tomato like sauce that accompanied it, a splash of fresh squeezed lemon did the trick. I can definitely see why my friends keep coming back here when they vacation.

The food here is spectacular. It's traditional Italian meets savory & decadent. The service was outstanding and the decor is really elegant and beautiful. We were lucky enough to meet Chef Michael who is down to earth and passionate about his craft.

Appetizers - I highly recommend the crab cake arancini, and the caprese salad with special imported bufala mozzarella from Italy.

Pastas - My absolute favorite was the Burrata Agnolotti with lobster. The sweet bread in the gnocchi dish was surprisingly delicious and had a slight crunch; and the Ripatelli had a savory spice that's quite addicting.

Entrees- Osso Buco - hands down is a must have, ask for a crostini for the bone marrow! 

Dessert - the Nutella creme brulee is an obvious winner, and the cheesecake was divine as well! 

The whole experience far exceeded our expectations, we had a great time and hope to be back again!

This was an amazing meal. My wife and I left so happy.
We sat down our waiter was so friendly and nice.
We ordered the meatballs and A salad.
 The presentation on the dish was amazing. And it tasted amazing.
So main course I did the rack of lamb ... Christ this was the best lamb I've had in a very long time it was just perfect and melted in my mouth. 
It was on bed of veggies and finger potatoes. My wife had the BURRATA AGNOLOTTI I wrote it like that because it was remarkable! And just she loved it and even took the bread to soak up the sauce which is unlike her. 
We had an after dinner drink and expresso. 
She did the 3 scoops of ice cream. Her face when she tried the strawberry was priceless " you havta try this now"  and it was amazing the ice cream.
I did the tiramisu which was a huge piece. I could barely finish. 
Between the waitstaff and the food it was perfect! 
And the cost wasn't to bad for what we ate and for the quality.

This place used to be so much better years ago, but is still a decent value for the money. Menu used to offer a lot more choices and their Grand Marnier souffle was to die for. But as everything else in Vegas, the fun times at this place had an expiration date written all over. Nevertheless, if you're in search for a place that offers decent food at reasonable prices, pleasant atmosphere and good service, you won't regret it. One of the best things is that even without a reservation you have a very good chance of getting a table, unlike some other more fashionable (and often overrated/overpriced) joints.

One of the best meals I have ever eaten! The Burrata Agnolotti pasta dish is the most delicious pasta on earth. It is ravioli filled with a sweet cheese accompanied with a lot of lobster pieces and in a wonderful mushroom sauce. I came to celebrate my birthday. Service was fantastic from start to finish. We made a reservation and were seated right away. From appetizers to entree to dessert all the food was mouthwatering. We ordered meatballs to start followed by the Burrata Agnolotti pasta. Then for dessert we got the Nutella creme brûlée. Wow is all I can say for the dessert! What an interesting twist to how creme brûlée is normally made but they perfected it to well. They also surprised me with a tiramisu dessert that was complimentary for my birthday. Will definitely be returning and will be telling all my friends about it! I highly recommend this restaurant.

Just got back from a weekend trip to Vegas and one of our meals was at Portofino. I ordered the Branzino for dinner. The fish was good, however the rest of the items on my plate - the potato leek gratin, grilled asparagus, and mushrooms - were way too salty. I took one bite of each but it was too salty for my palate. I had my boyfriend try each and he agreed that they were too salty. Maybe I selected the wrong dish and should have kept to the dishes the waiter highlighted as the restaurant's most loved. Oh well.
AMAZING birthday dinner with the best host and most importantly the greatest friends.

I've been meaning to write a review for this place for a while. It's tucked in the corner of the Mirage casino, and bit out-shined in appearance by its flashier neighbors, but this wine bar/restaurant is definitely worth your time. They have an extensive selection of cheeses, if that's your thing, and my entree (gnocchi w/ chicken) was the best I've ever had. Service was excellent, and since it's sort of hidden, there was no wait time. Will definitely try to come back when I'm in Vegas again.

My wife and I came in on a Sunday without reservations, yet they were happy to accommodate us.  We were greeted very pleasantly and seated immediately.  The ambiance is very romantic, quiet, and private.  Delicious herb bread infused with extra virgin olive oil was brought to the table.  We ordered and received a bottle of Pellegrino and the server is very knowledgeable about the menu and ready to make recommendations.  I ordered the wild boar pasta and since my wife couldn't make up her mind he offered her to receive two half dishes.  She had the butternut squash gnocchi and a shrimp pasta dish. She reports both were to die for.  The manager came to ensure our meal was acceptable and filled my tea.  My wife finished with a Sambuco.  An overall pleasant experience. The reason I did not offer a five star review is the time between ordering and being served our food was very long.  I don't mind waiting for good food and this food was fabulous, however it would have been nice if our server would have checked on us during the wait. We were out of water and tea, therefore the bread sat there.  Great night.

Let me start by saying, this place is kind of an anomaly for The Mirage. I would expect to find it in the Wynn or Encore.

I ate here with a group of 6 and everyone was equally satisfied with their entree. Even the bread was delicious and needed no oil or balsamic!

We started with the fried calamari (HUGE portion), burrata caprese (yum!), and ricotta crab cake (super impressed with the creativity behind this one, and equally impressed by the unique flavors and crispy exterior! Enough for about three people to split).

For my entree I ordered the buratta lobster Agnolotti (ravioli) (yes, all your favorite things in one dish) which came in the most amazing creamy sauce. Highly recommended! 

Our waiter was super friendly and knew the menu like the back of his hand. 

Whoever you are Michael LaPlaca--thank you!!!

Came here with my friend to try the Italian food here. We got seated near the front by the bar so I couldn't see the whole inside of the restaurant. They have real light candles at every table for dinner. We ordered the soup with sausage for appetizer, the lamb for myself, and my friend got lasagna. The soup was very good. It was flavorful and I liked the noodles and sausage in it. They can go easier on the beans though, I thought there was a bit too much beans in it but taste was good for the soup. My lamb was delicious. The meat was tender and flavorful. Perfectly cooked for my taste. I didn't care for the stuff that came with my lamb. I wish they had put asparagus and mash potatoes or something better with the lamb. I just ate all of lamb and didn't touch the sides. The lasagna was decent. Was expecting the lasagna to be better than it came out but it was ok. The bread that they give you though is very good. It's soft and has olive oil on it. We ordered the chocolate cake with ice cream for dessert. It was good. Overall I recommend getting the lamb and soup here.

Perfect dinner perfect atmosphere great night. Everything we ate was better than expected including the crab cake, salmon, and the beet salad. Server was Sam who was awesome.  He noticed my wife wasn't enjoying her drink so he brought her something else which she loved.  Overall a highlight of our stay in Vegas!

I have been to Onda many times over the years when I head to Vegas.  I remember the first time I went there in 2002, I was extremely impressed by the quality of their Filet Mignon and have been impressed by it many times since.  I honestly think the steak they serve at Onda is amongst the best I have eaten and I have eaten in many steakhouses all over the country and all over the world.  

They also have an extensive wine list that isn't too rude $$$ wise! 

I notice below that many people remark on the pasta dishes and say they were unimpressed.  If you are heading to Onda I would throughly recommend trying the Filet, it's out of this world!

We were lookin for a quick and nice dinner out before the 7pm Beatles LOVE Show.  We made a 515pm reservation and got right in.  Its definitely a high end wine bar/restraunt, but we managed to find some decently priced glasses of wine.  Chuck was our waiter and was awesome!  He asked if we were headed for the next show, and said he would make sure we wouldn't be late.  We all thought that was very thoughtful.

We all tried their Caesar salad, which was perfectly assembled.  It wasn't just chopped up romaine out of a bag.  

The Chicken Parmigiano and the Burrata Agnolotti were both very favorable dishes.

Fantastic find! We stumbled across this restaurant and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening here. We started with the cappers salad with buffalo mozzarella that was some of the best we have had. We then moved to dinner and the Burrata Agnolotti exceeded expectations. Great from start to finish. The chef Michael even came out which was a nice surprise , genuine guy who loves creating dishes . We will be back!

First time I try the food at  the Mirage and it was quite an experience.  We tried Onda on a Friday evening before the Cirque du Soleil, Beatles "LOVE" show.  The restaurant is right across from the theater so I recommend it for those that plan to have a nice dinner before the show.

This place has top notch service.  Even though this was Friday dinner time we still had 3 waiters checking up on water, wine, orders, etc.  Great service!

I ordered the Gnocchi along with the $60something wine bottle we ordered.  The gnocchi was exactly what I expected, full of flavor, texture and it melted in my mouth.  The sauce was a bit different but complemented the gnocchi perfectly.  

Expect to spend about $50-$70 if you go for the cheapest wine bottles when you go to Onda and try the Gnocchi!

This place is the worst!!!!  The only thing worth it is the homemade grisssini.  

The fettuccine Alfredo looked like it came from olive garden, very dull and bland.  I ordered the steak special and for $65 I received a steak that was ok, not great, barely ok and a blob of something they called garlic rosemary mashed potatoes.  No way, it had NO FLAVOR!!!!!

The creme brûlée was weepy and watery and the only good part was the wonderful  berries on top!!!  

Save your money, this place is not cheap and there are MANY other options you can choose from.  One worth pursuing is the steak place in NY NY......

I had the veal bocca. I really enjoyed my meal and so did the rest of my friends. I ordered the calamari for a appetizer. The batter was light and flaky. Be carful not to fill up on the bread. It was very tasty.

Onda has a nice menu selection.  Talk about an amazing seafood tower!  Holy smokes - I just might have to upload the picture for you!

I also ordered the seafood pasta and for our table we got the lobster milanese - which is very rich - watch out.

As though that wasn't enough calories - for dessert - they have the most amazing vanilla souffle - which you need to pre-order since it takes awhile to make (as most souffles do).   You get two little shortbread sugar cookies to go with it.  Sometimes they have a lemon one - which I did not get to try - heard that was really divine!

The Good: It's LV fine dining, so expect high prices for good food and a variety of fine wines.  Since my girlfriend and I arrived late, we had to settle for the wine lounge, but our experience was still pretty good.  The wines were tasty, and the food was delicious.  I also liked how they brought breadsticks and such with a small olive dish.

The Bad: It took about 5 minutes for us to receive our menus and then another 5 for our orders to be taken.  Tsk tsk.

Try: the lasagna.  I know it may sound dull to order a lasagna in Vegas, but wow, this was good.  It was huge with many layers and it comes with a side of asparagus.  

Don't Try: the olive plate if you do not like salty foods.  My girlfriend hates olives.  (The Olive Theory for you HIMYM fans)

Came here for a birthday celebration. Had the Branzino (Mediterranean sea bass) and Osso Bucco. Both were amazing but the Branzino was AWESOME! 

Had tiramisu for dessert which was also really good. It's a tad pricey (not for the Strip though) but if not for that it'd totally get 5 stars in my book... great food but not sure if it's $100+ great.

We came with a group of friends and had a nice time. Service was attentive. I had the lobster and corn ravioli, the BF had the chicken parmesean, and we shared the meatballs. We were happy with everything. The ravioli was easily the favorite. The lobster was tender and succulent and the corn added a really nice hint of sweetness. The chicken parmesean was good but a much heavier dish. The meatballs were great. Everyone else seemed happy with their dishes too, so a win-win! I would recommend.

Four of us went to Vegas for a "Girls' Weekend" and picked up discount dinner coupons for Portofinos, at the Mirage, at a Tickets for Tonight stand on The Strip. We paid $2-3 for the coupon which was good for 30% off the entire meal. We also got a $50 food credit per room to use in a Mirage restaurant when we booked our rooms, so we saved a lot of money. We all agreed that it was one of the best, if not THE best meal (and dessert!) we have ever eaten! Add to that the really efficient, professional, personable waiter, Chuck, and fabulous busboy, Manuel (who left the restaurant to get my friend a can of root beer which they don't serve there. He also got an extra can so she could have a refill!). The whole night was like that; special touches and so attentive. After we raved about the food, they even brought out Chef Michael so we could compliment him personally. We could not have asked for better food, service, or ambiance. Highly recommend Portifinos!!

This restaurant, formerly Onda, has been firing on all cylinders since Chef Michael LaPlaca took the reins to both the menu and kitchen.  We received a basket of warm garlic ciabatta and ordered the chef's signature appetizer, crab cake arancini (lemon saffron risotto, pesto aioli with fresno pickles). It was very good, but seriously overpriced so I would not order it again. Ann's entree was another signature dish, chicken rollatini Parmesan which was entirely different from the usual chicken Parm in that a house made sausage using leg and thigh meat is wrapped inside a chicken breast that has been lightly breaded and topped with marinara and mozzarella. This dish proved to be almost as bountiful as it was delicious. Not to be outdone, I chose the chef's signature pasta, burrata agnolotti (lobster, chanterelle mushrooms, roasted corn butter) which was rich in flavors. Neither of us departed unsatisfied.
This place is to die for. Get the burrata agnolotti! The only thing is they don't celebrate your birthday. Other than that this was a wonderful experience

In town for the rock and roll marathon and still celebrating the hubs birthday with dinner here. First it's a pretty generational contrast to the otherwise under 40 crowd that mostly roams Vegas. The hubs had a branzino (sea bass) but the way it was prepared - shredded and fried - gave it a more grazing animal taste if you will. Ok I'll say it -it tastes like chicken. Not sure that's the experience the chef wanted and for what it costs ($36) I'm not sure it was worth it, but then again when I'm paying high dollar for meals, they need to perform at a high standard and Portofino doesn't do that. They do however have a vegetarian menu which 2 of us ordered from (vegetarian pastas for over $30), burrata ravioli and another cheese filled pasta with root veggies. Both were good but too rich and probably not great for a carb load with the higher fat and cream content. The homemade burrata pasta with lobster was tasty, but also quite heavy. So if you like heavy cream based pasta this is for you! The restaurant is quiet and doesn't smell like smoke like the rest of the casino so that's a plus. Service was good. no pictures sorry.
Food was delicious! I had the butternut squash gnocchi. My bf even received 20% off of our bill bc he was a local. How awesome. We will definitely be coming back.

We dined here on Friday and I was extremely impressed, my girlfriend has a dairy allergy and we were a little concerned if she would be able to eat here. The manager Chris was AMAZING, he went above and beyond to make sure that her needs were taken care of and that meant a lot to us. The service was perfect, the food was amazing, the atmosphere was beautiful. I seriously hope Chris is well compensated at that place because he absolutely deserves it. Can't recommend this place enough!

My husband and I went there for dinner last Friday and the service by Chris, the manager and the staff was all above and beyond our expectations. Chris was especially accommodating. My husband and I liked two different appetizers but we were just going to order one to share and couldn't agree on which to order. Chris immediately offered to split the two appetizers into 2 half orders so we wouldn't have to compromise or order 2 full orders of appetizers. I had the grilled octopus for appetizers and it was by far the best one I've ever eaten, compared to a lot of other celebrity chefs' restaurants I've been to that also offer grilled octopus on their menu. I will definitely go back for that dish and for the excellent service!
The food was excellent! The wait staff was very attentive and gave us great recommendations. Nice ambiance and a wonderful place for a special occasion or just to celebrate being together!

First time dining here. Beautiful bar and a great selection of wines, and the price not to high. My server was sharp real sharp! He knew the menu top to bottom. My food was good. I had the snapper. It was over cooked and a little tuff. That's why I can only give this 4 stars. But all in all I was very pleased.

Skip this place ! Only one star only because I couldn't give it less. Located in the Mirage, this overpriced Italian restaurant was a disappointment for all ! We had a large party of 12, we ordered and sampled just about everything on the menu. Each person was disappointed with either the lack of depth and flavoring, the super dry, grey colored steak, which was ordered medium, the pasta sauce was bland , the carrots were rock hard, every dish was just an all around disappointment for the very high prices we paid. The lemonchello Creme Brûlée was very good but the rest of our group that ordered the 
Ice cream were disappointed when they read it comes with three scoops and when it arrived there was only one scoop. Something is not right with the whole place and I would suggest going over to the Bellagio for Italian.

We went there for dinner after watching the Cirque du Soleil/ Beatles "Love" show which set the bar quite high for the remainder of the evening. I liked the "typically Vegas" hotel venue, although it was possibly a bit large, which made it look emptier than it was and therefore less intimate. We ordered margaritas for an aperitif and they were good, although I am not sure fresh lime juice was used - as they were a tiny bit on the artificially sweet side. The food was excellent: our shared Caprese salad delicious, the freshness of the ingredients evident, and our pasta dishes (lasagna and veal cannelloni) to die for - and served in large yet elegant portions. I was also chuffed to see they had a bottle of Vermentino (one of my favorite grapes after we discovered it in a small joint in Venice last summer) on the extensive wine list, at a very reasonable price, the light and fresh taste of which did not disappoint. Service was pleasant and efficient although our main dishes did take a while to appear - but when they did, they tasted so delightfully fresh that we instantly forgave and forgot the waiting time. Overall a very nice Vegas dining experience.
Met an old close friend for dinner at Portofino.  Great intimate dinning with class. Excellent pasta and meat dishes. Delightful service and great drinks. Will come back!

This is amongst the best Italian food that I've ever had. I would put the meal I had just slightly below the fare I had from Michael Chiarello's Bottega in Napa Valley (which is the best Italian I've had). Everything was done with a lot of finesse and the service was very pleasant. Pretty decent atmosphere. Nothing like Bottega by any means but for Vegas it was very nice.

We started with the arugula salad. Which i found to be very good. The price is high but what do you expect in Vegas? The food was good but it is a lot to be spending on food that wasn't anything spectacular.. Lasagna was okay the salmon was much better!!

With so many restaurant options in Vegas, a person could easily be overwhelmed and not know where to start when looking for dinner... but we picked Portofino and we were so glad we did!!! They offer reservations through both open table and their direct website, although we had an early dinner before a show and there were definitely open tables. Our waiter was really nice and helpful in picking out both dinner and drink options... we both got pasta dishes, and the gnocchi and agnolotti were both SO good. Between the hand made pastas, the super tasty sauces (they were truffle based and a 'corn butter') but they were not overly heavy but had so much flavor!! The drinks were really yummy, and the caprese salad had a punch of flavor. Everything here was simple and yet at the same time SO SO good! Just writing this review makes my mouth water.... I would absolutely return in the future when visiting, or perhaps they will open a restaurant in San Diego sometime soon?!?

I came here to enjoy some wine. When you enter you are greeted with a big smile and welcome. So I decided to seat the bar after a long day of gambling. I asked the bartender for a great glass of red wine. So the bartender would you like. As I said surprise me. I ended up having a glass of red merlot the was truly amazing.

The next time I come back I plan to have dinner. As the food looked amazing. If you are a person who appreciates a great wine and Italian food Portofino by Chef Michael LaPlaca is a must.
